panjana.entry: qáṭu wìrtɛla, |  npílta gu-d-án panjàne |  mqurə̀dxela |  ʾánna ṛìšela |  A cat came in, fell into the glasses, they shattered and they woke up (A4:53).

panya.entry: ʾaṣərta yoma gnele panya ṭalana rpele In the evening the sun set and cast a shadow on the shadow side of the mountain (C2:5)

p-ape.entry: hóla p-ápe šawwà yamáθa |  She is beyond seven seas (A12:21); qímtɛla musáqtəlle bróna dìya |  p-ápe xa-gằra, |  prìmtəlle |  She went and took up her young cub the other side of a hill and slaughtered it (A33:13).

paqota.gloss: dish consisting of wheat dumplings and meat

paṛa.2.entry: zawge ʾu-paṛe even and odd numbers

para.entry: qaríwtux ʾúpra-w pàra |  Your companion is earth and fine dust (A38:9)

para.2.gloss: coin; silver disk decoration on the tita (string of decorative disks worn by women on the forehead)

păra.entry: tiwle păra The first rain has settled (and the ground is muddy)

pardɛsa.entry: xzéli b-xə̀lmi |  ʾìna |  ʾána zíla l-pardɛ̀sa |  l-á-dunye xèta |  I dreamt that I went to Paradise to the next life (A2:7); ʾálaha maníxle gu-nóhra ʾu-pardɛ̀sa |  May God grant him rest in light and paradise (said after the death of somebody); (gu-)pardɛ́sa bábux ʾu-yə̀mmux May your father and mother be in paradise (said in thanks to somebody’s good wishes).

parma.2.entry: skinta parəmtɛla the knife cuts well (it is sharp)

paṛma.entry: producing a sweet edible fruit called baluṭe (sing. baluṭa)

paroxa.entry: ṭɛ́ra paròxɛle |  a bird is a flying creature

parṣopa.entry: ʾa-parṣópa díyux hátxa jwànqa |  This face of yours, which is so handsome (A8:41)

parta.gloss: husks of rice left after rice is hulled and ground; remains left in sieve after sieving; scraps of wool left on floor after carding

partəkka.gloss: loose wisp of wool/hair (falling on ground after carding)
partəkka.entry: ʾámṛe díye partə̀kkɛle |  Its wool is full of loose wisps; káwse díye píšle partə̀kke |  His hair has become dishevelled.

paruða.entry: qamxa paruða coarse flour, as opposed to qamxa daqiqa finely ground flour.

paruxa.entry: ṭɛ́ra parùxɛle |  A bird is able to fly.

parwana.entry: mìya |  mazəvríle xa-parwàna |  The water drives round a propeller (of a water mill) (B6:53)

parxa lɛle.entry: Literally: night-flyer → parəxtət lɛle, parxantət lɛle

parxe.entry: šanə parxe chicken-pox (literally: honeycomb of peeling skin)

parzena.entry: its long thorns (known as kălame) are used for making fences.

parzūn.entry: used for carrying everyday items and by bride to carry dowry

pasuta.entry: bēl-šə́dla l-šə̀dla |  gắrəg mátteti xa-xamšá ʾaqlàθa, |  xamšá pasùwe |  Between the saplings you must leave about five steps, five paces (B5:103).

pašxa rase.gloss: late snow in the month of April

paṭiroke.entry: resembling hemza with tendrils (zolale) running along the ground and a pungent root

paṭoša.entry: ʾən-ʾárdət ṣawə́lta xrùle, |  maxə́lla paṭòša |  If the bottom of a shoe is damaged, they put patch on it; paṭošət ṭina muddy mark (on clothes)

paṭoxa.gloss: flattened piece of cattle dung used for fuel

paθa.gloss: face; front; upper surface; side (of river).
paθa.entry: (1) face | mxúlla páθe dìye |  He washed his face (A14:27); ʾáp-xa mən-díyən lɛ́le mə́ṣya kə́lya gu-páθe dìye |  None of us can face him; díya gu-pàθux |  mdàgəl |  He will now lie to your face (A6:11); rəḥqa mən-paθa Let it be far from the face (said after mentioning something untoward or unpleasant); xabūš paθa cheek-bone (literally: apple of the face); kōm-paθa black-faced, disgraced, xwār-paθa white-faced, innocent; šaqlanət paθwaθa two-faced, deceitful.; (2) front | paθət guda front of wall facing outwards (as opposed to băṭăna inside of wall), outside row of stones; kepət paθa stones of the facing (small white stones used to cover outer wall of house B5:180).; (3) upper surface | paθət miya surface of water; paθət ṣawle top of shoes; paθət mēz table-cloth; l-páθa d-o-gúpta dɛréwa matúwwa ṭàrpe |  Over the surface of the cheese they would put leaves (B5:169).; (4) side (of river) | l-a-páθa xétət nèra |  on the other side of the river (A14:50).

pawxa.entry: ṱ-óyən ... waðə́llux pàwxa |  I shall give you air (to keep cool) (A27:38)

paxalta.entry: sí-ṭlub paxálta mə́nne dìye |  Go and ask forgiveness from him (A1:10); paxàlta, |  lá-mṣən ʾáθən ʾə̀dyo |  Sorry, I cannot come today.

p̭azesor.entry: p̭azesór b-ʾəlyàθa, |  hátxa b-qanàne |  red eared sheep with fat tails and horns like this (A7:22); xa-ʾərbət pazesor a red eared sheep

pč̣ila.entry: ʾurxa pč̣ilta winding road; ʾáwwa tărɛ́xu pč̣ìlɛle |  This door of yours is crooked (A17:20); tú pč̣ìla, |  mṣáwəθ dū̀z |  Sit crooked, but tell the truth (D2:60).

pela.2.entry: tálga lá mattúle pèle |  The snow will not put aside its fate (D2:45), i.e. a person cannot change his character.

p̣ena.entry: mxaya p̣ena to kick: qəm-maxyála ðà-p̣ena |  She gave me a kick (B5:132); b-ðá-ʾaqla díya p̣éna qəm-maxyáli ʾàxxa |  With one of its legs it kicked me here (A5:132); p̣enàne maxyátli! |  You kick me! (A27:41).

peruzana.gloss: gift given on the birth of child

pəčča.entry: qəm-awə́dla tre-pə̀čče |  He cut her into two pieces (A51:18).

pəddoma.entry: used to stop mouth of a kwara (storage basket), a mziða (storage bag) or a guða (skin)

pənxa.entry: pənxa ḷaya upper millstone; pənxa xtaya lower millstone; mattíwa ... pə́nxət ʾə̀rxe. |  ʾíθwa ʾo-t-kʸépa ʾáw ʾo-t-xə̀ṭṭe, |  y-oðíwa qàmxa, |  ʾína ʾáw t-rə̀zza |  ʾíwa t-qɛ̀sa |  They would install a grinding wheel of a water-mill. There was a stone, which was for wheat, with which they made flour, but the one for rice was of wood (B5:90); mattále xa-pə̀nxət |  šáwwi šawwá pə́rse rəš-ṣádre dìye |  She put a millstone (capable of being lifted only by) seventy-seven heroic men onto his chest (A50:7).

p̣əqqa.entry: p̣əqqət ʾaqla arch of sole of foot

pərč̭əmta.entry: pálgət pərč̭ə́mte dìye |  xríxla qam-yòma |  Half of his forelock was singed by the sun (A50:11); xá pərč̭ə́mta dìye |  ... t-dáwa-w xa-t-sèma |  one forelock of his ... was of gold and one was of silver (sign of beauty) (A8:6).

p̭ərruš.entry: m-o-kalbət p̭ərruš wele ṣlele rəš-kalləš klele xəmyanət Dalle bxele On account of that dog which was treacherous, which went down and stood over carrion, the father-in-law of Dalle wept (C8:9).

pərsa.entry: mattále xa-pə̀nxət |  šáwwi šawwá pə́rse rəš-ṣádre dìye |  She put a millstone (capable of being lifted only by) seventy-seven heroic men onto his chest (A50:7) → ferəssa.

pərsange.gloss: game in which players compete in the throwing of heavy stones

pərṣət.entry: lítlux pyáša pə̀rṣət. |  dìya qaṭlə́xlux. |  You have no chance (of escape). We shall kill you now. (A26:76)

pəškəlle.gloss: droppings of goats or sheep that have not been broken up by trampling

pəškoža.entry: xanjar t-xoni pəškože The dagger of my brother has (golden) decorations (C5:3).

pəšpəšyaθa.gloss: the first flakes of snowing that fall in a snow storm
pəšpəšyaθa.entry: ráya pəšpəšyàθa |  the first flakes of snow are falling.

pəṣla.entry: liθ bəṛ-náša hátxa b-aw-pə̀ṣla díyux |  There is nobody with such a (beautiful) figure as yours (A8:41); ʾu-b-ó pəṣlà |  ʾi-mtarṣíwa gùpta |  In this way they used to make cheese (B5:171).

pəθwana.entry: pəθwane zɛdi l-xure His strides exceed (in size those) of his friends (Qaṭina).

pəxla.gloss: young sheep or calf that has not yet been castrated

pilawe.entry: ʾu-piláwe píšla šmìṭe |  My shoes have become broken (A37:17).

pipa.gloss: cage for partridge chicks made from a gourd

pista.gloss: leather bag ( for carrying jajək and yoghurt)

pišanga.entry: keptət pišanga the lead head of the bullet; masoqe pišanga gu-tope to load a gun; kú pušánga ṱ-íx mattóyəlle gu-d-ay-tòpe |  čŭ̀ruk-ile pláṭa |  Every bullet that we put in this gun comes out with a bang (B9:21).

pištamasi.gloss: long chine of meat on the back of sheep in the shape of a fish

pixa.entry: b-yárxət ʾə̀ṣra |  xadə̀ssər |  y-óya pìxta dúnye |  In October or November the weather is cool (B5:177).

plaša.entry: wéle pláša bēn-ʾáskar-t málkət ʾÌrən |  ʾu-ʾàw |  There was a war between him and the army of the king of Iran (A11:16); qám-plaša qamàya |  before the First World War (B17:1).

poše.gloss: goat having a white spot on the head
poše.entry: guði t-ʾəzzi d-ɛ-poše My churn from my goat called ‘white spotted’ (C5:3).

poθa.gloss: root of madder used to dye clothes and colour eggs red at Easter

prage.entry: xa dandəkθət prage a single millet seed; prage maṭoye a type of millet that ripens quickly; prage kurize a type of millet that ripens slowly

prasa.gloss: cloth spread on floor on which food is laid

prasta.gloss: goat’s skin spread on the floor

prəzla.entry: xa-prə̀zla |  a piece of iron (A14:12); šíšət prə̀zla |  iron bars (A19:4)

prista.gloss: spread, covering for floor (such as rug or carpet)

priša.entry: (1) different | zrútət xə́ṭṭe prìštɛla |  The cultivation of wheat is different (B5:94); pálṭi wɛ̀rde, |  bɛ́hɛr y-áwɛ príše prìše |  Flowers come out, in Spring there are lots of different kinds (B5:176).; (2) special, choice | rába xá-mdi prìšɛla júllux gu-d-ánna diyɛ́ni |  Your clothes are something very special compared with ours (A35:10); ʾína mástət ʾə́rwe rába biš-basimtɛ́la biš-príštɛla mən-d-a-t-tàwre |  But the yoghurt of sheep is much better and more choice than that of cattle (B5:173).; (3) various | Placed before the nominal: priše məndiyane various things.

prora.entry: dukθa prorta an open place, ʾurxa prorta an open road; ʾíθ dùkθa, |  pròrtɛla, |  máṣi mṭàli gáwa |  There is a place that is open, in which they can play (B11:30).

pšiṭa.entry: rába pšìṭṭɛwa xayúθa díyən gu-maθwáθa |  Our life in the villages was very simple (B15:12); ʾáti náša pšìṭɛwət |  You are a fine person.

pṭoxa.entry: parša pṭoxa a flat stone; bəṛ-gare pṭoxta a flat plateau

pθana.entry: pθánət tàwre |  a pair of oxen (B5:73).

pθila.entry: xaθux patla pθile Your sister twists twisted threads (A50:15).

pθilta.entry: šráya ʾítle pθíltət ktàna |  A lamp has a wick of cotton.

pukta.entry: qəm-doqáli pùkta |  I had a bout of hiccups.

pumma.gloss: mouth (of body or vessel); end of a spade
pumma.entry: pumma pṭoxa wide end (of a spade)

punda.entry: mălə́xwa pundàθa |  We would light wicks.

purəpxina.entry: herb that is put in jajək

purta.gloss: sheep’s dung that has been broken up (mpurtəxa) by the trampling of their feet

purya.entry: hóle xa-púrya láxxa zòra |  There is a small chink of light here (A14:25).

puwuš.gloss: hay from fibres of rice plant

pxiša.gloss: paste made of flour and oil

qaba.entry: Xasắdo t-šáwwa qábe ʾaw-bə̀ṣlɛle |  Xasădo who has seven gowns is an onion (D1:15).

qăbux.entry: ʾáni qári qắbux l-ġðàðe |  They challenged one another to fight (A29:59).

qačamiθa.gloss: waste grains falling from a water-mill
qačamiθa.entry: These are swept up and given to animals to eat.

qăda.entry: tắra dwìra |  qắda wìra |  If the door is closed, trouble passes by (D2:47).

qadalta.entry: xa-qadáltə dàwe |  a pot of gold (A10:7)

qadida.entry: This is dried on the bone by hanging

qaḍiya.entry: hátxɛla qaḍìya |  The situation is like this (A21:8).

qadra.entry: (1) amount | yăðíwa mo-qádra dɛrɛ̀wa |  They knew what quantity to put on (B5:191); yáwa nišánqa ma-qádrɛla mkawòre, |  ma-qádrɛla qwìθa |  It gives a sign as to how much (arak) is distilling, how strong it is; pšúṭla ʾàqlux |  qắdər bărə̀kθux |  Stretch your legs according to your cloth (D1:6).; (2) respect | qəm-dawə́qle qádra dìya |  He showed them respect (A12:37).

qăhər.entry: θéle qằhər-ʾəlle |  Sadness came upon him (A14:87).

qala.entry: (1) voice | qále díye rába basìmɛwa |  His voice was very beautiful (A25:43); léš-maṣe-náša palə́ṭle qále dìye |  A person can no longer utter his voice (B15:39); ʾímə ṱ-íle zmàra, |  bulbúle jmáʾela l-qàle |  When he sings, nightingales gather at his voice (A25:46).; (2) utterance, shout | ṣríxɛle xa-qála ràba xɛlána |  He shouted a mighty shout (A11:3).; (3) song | zmírre xa-qála b-súse dìye |  He sang a song to his horse (A25:55).; (4) sound | qálət maymùne |  the sound of monkeys (A14:43); qalət tope gunshot; ʾáwwa mò-qalət bə́xyɛle? |  What sound of weeping is this? (A4:44); ʾímət ʾàθya, |  mzàngər zága, |  ʾáxni šămə́xle qále ṱ-árqəx mṭàšəx |  When it (the cat) comes, the bell will sound, we shall hear its sound and run and hide (A44:2).

qălama.gloss: pen; protruding branch of a tree
qălama.entry: qălamət xurta the protruding branches of willow; qălamət prəzla chisel

qalaša.entry: ṭɛ́re xáləlla qalášət gùṛe |  Birds are eating the corpses of men (B9:32).

qalɛθa.entry: qaddištət qalayaθa the Saint of the Cells (name of a church in Walto B9:30)

qalpa.entry: xá-qapla qɛ̀se |  t-lá-hawa b-qàlpe |  a bundle of pieces of wood that are without bark (A30:6); qalpət nune scales of a fish

qalula.entry: xánči ṱ-amrə́nna qalùlta |  qa-t-pàrqa |  I’ll tell it (the story) to you quickly so that it will finish (A4:5).

qalwa.gloss: wooden mold in which fabric is pressed

qalya.gloss: meat roasted in fat and preserved for winter

qama qama.entry: With actions involving movement: ʾə́θyela tré malàxe, |  pyáða qama-qámət čádra d-ò-malka |  Two angels came, passing in front of the tent of the king (A4:2).

qamaya.entry: yóma qamàya on the first day (A25:14); har-ʾánna qamàyela |  They are the same as the ones before them (A27:27).

qamaye.entry: qamáye xírta b-áqlət súsa dìya |  At first she looked at the legs of her horse (A8:72); ku-brónət bə́ṛ-naša ʾáθe l-d-áy jăzíra qamàye, |  ʾáwwa ṱ-áwe málka diyɛ̀xu |  Whichever person comes to the island first, he will be your king (A14:46); y-azə́xwa kalə́xwa m-qamàye |  We went and stood at the front (in the first row of the congregation) (B15:82); bə́nta qamàye for the first time (B5:1).

qamčiya.entry: imported to the villages from towns

qamoθ.entry: only used in expressions of meeting: xúwwe plíṭɛle l-qamòθe |  The snake came out to meet him (A1:18); yáwəx xàbra |  ta-t-pálṭi l-qamòθən |  We give word for them to come out to meet us (A4:30).

qamxa.entry: maṣlɛ́wala ʾə̀rxe, |  ṭaxnìwala, |  pɛ́ši qàmxa |  They would take it (the wheat xəṭṭe) down to the water-mill and grind it and it would become flour (B5:15).

qana.gloss: horn; horn container used to carry grease (məšxa) for applying to the whetsone (məšna); peak of a mountain
qana.entry: lá-mɛθət m-an-t-qanàne |  Do not bring those (sheep) with horns (A7:24); parxəx l-qanət ʾAvraza Let us fly up to the peak of Avraza (C2:83).

qanaθe.gloss: metal finger covers worn by harvesters

qapəlta.entry: xə́ṭṭe m-sənnòrta, |  yála m-qapə̀lta |  Wheat (is seen to be good) from when it is a shoot. A child (is seen to be good) from the time of (his mother’s) embrace. (D2:36)

qăpəx.entry: ta-ṱ-óðən qắpəx ʾàp ṭla-réšəx |  until I make a lid also for your head (A20:3).

qapla.gloss: armful; bundle carried in arms; arms
qapla.entry: jămíwale y-oðíwale qàpla |  They gathered it (the rice hay) and made it into an armful (B5:84); xá-qapla qɛ̀se |  a bundle of pieces of wood (A30:6); qápli hóle ṃḷàya |  My arms are full (B15:89); qəm-šaqlánne gu-qàpli |  I took him in my arms (B9:25); mə́xyəlle qáple bìye |  dwìqəlle |  He put out his hands and caught him (A29:31).

qapyo.gloss: blockage; twigs and grass blocking flow of a water channel

qaqna.entry: This is yellow in colour and grows in the mountains. When the sap sets it produces a gum known as deθa, which is softened in water and then chewed.

qărama.entry: fed to sheep to make them give more milk

qăratiθa.gloss: pieces of rasa grass fed to young lambs in a pen (kosta)

qare.entry: téla qəm-doqìle |  mə́re ku-mə́ndit băyítu wúðu bìyi, |  bás gu-qáre t-kθayáθa là dɛrɛ́tuli! |  They caught the fox and it said ‘Do with me what you will, but do not put me in the chicken coop’.

qarəkθonta.entry: qarə́kke qarəkθònti |  O crow, my little crow (A34:3)

qăreθa.gloss: vessel (for water and storage) made from a gourd

qariwa.gloss: close friend; best man (at a wedding), godfather
qariwa.entry: qariwi my friend (said by a Christian to a Jew or vice versa).

qariwta.gloss: bridesmaid; female companion of bride and groom at a wedding

qarqupθa.entry: qarqúpθe sapìqtɛla |  His head is empty (he is a fool)

qarša.gloss: small wooden strip made of juniper laid across beams in a roof
qarša.entry: kú ṱ-íle ṣláya xo-qárše ʾə̀ltəx, |  pyáša dàwa |  Everything that fell down under the beams became gold (A10:11). → syn. nira

qaruṭa.entry: ʾə́nwə baṣírana qarùṭela |  The baṣirana grapes are tough.

qaruθa.entry: buxára máṭe l-qarùθa, |  páyəš ṭə́pye ṭə̀pye |  The steam becomes cool and turns into drops.

qarwən.gloss: caravan, convoy (of mules) that transports merchandise
qarwən.entry: y-azíwa qàrwən |  They would go in a convoy (B5:124)

qarθa.entry: qàrθɛla |  It is cold; t-lá-hoya qàrθa-ʾəlləx |  so that you are not cold (A20:2).

qaṣra.gloss: palace; large house (consisting of two storeys and made of dressed stones)
qaṣra.entry: bráte díye muttúla qáṣre ʾu-qaṣòre |  His daughter established villas and palaces (A40:7).

qaṣxane.entry: used to warm milk to make yoghurt

qatta.gloss: stick; handle of a knife, hilt of sword; sheath of a sword
qatta.entry: qattət xanjare komta The handle of his dagger was black (C2:55); qəm-maxéle bə-b-qàtta |  He struck it (the sword) together with the sheath (A52:18).

qatxa.entry: ʾɛnile gawṛa m-guṛe ... šatele qatxət šteli? Who is the man amongst men ... who could drink the glass I have drunk?(A50:3)

qaṭota.entry: (1) break in an irrigation channel (šaqiθa) to stop or redirect the flow of water | prí míya b-qaṭòta! |  Cut off the water flow!; (2) cutting down of leaves; leaves that have been cut down (and gathered for fodder) | lítli qaṭóta ʾə̀ššeta |  I do not have any gathered leaves this year.; (3) dirt left in a sieve after sieving | cf. qəmmoṭa

qawla.entry: ʾàwwɛle qawla-díyi |  This is my word (A8:79); dwíqla xa-qáwla m-an-qurðàye |  She extracted a promise from the Kurds (B9:12); b-ó-qawla b-ṣályən mənnɛ̀xu |  t-lá ʾamrítu púš qurðɛ̀θa |  I shall go down with you on this condition that you do not say ‘Become a Kurd’ (B9:12).

qawwa.entry: tiwta b-qwaya b-qawwa She is sitting scooping with a scoop (C2:8).

qayiš.gloss: man’s belt made of leather → šəbbaqa

qazd.entry: yắðət módi-wawa qázde dìye? |  Do you know what his intention was? (A17:16); wíðɛle qázd d-ò-bɛθa |  He made his way towards that house (A14:75).

qbila.entry: ʾən-lá zɛrə́nna Qŭ̀dus, |  lɛ̀la qbílta ḥajjiyúθi |  If I do not visit Jerusalem, my pilgrimage is not accepted (A2:1).

qðala.entry: pəlxánət bɛ́θa hóle b-qðàli |  The housework is my responsibility (A21:27); xṭíθi b-qðalɛ̀xu |  bnóni qam-ʾɛ́ni là qaṭlítula |  I implore you (literally: my sin be on your neck), do not kill my children before my eyes (B9:13)

qedamta.entry: mən-sab-ʾɛ́-ʾotəx t-là-hawe gáwa ṣópa, |  yáʿni pɛšáwa tàlga hal-qedámta |  Since a room that did not have a stove in it would become icy by the morning (B15:26); hal-qedámta šə́nθe la-θèla |  Right up to the morning he did not sleep (A6:4). qèdamtɛla, |  wíðtəlle ʾixàla |  (When) it was morning, she made him food (A24:4); wítɛla qedámta sáʾət ʾárpa b-lɛ̀le, |  ṛìšɛle |  màlka |  (When) the morning came, four o’clock in the morning, the king woke up (A17:27). Used adverbially: in the morning | qédamta y-ázi náše l-ʾùmra |  In the morning people go to church (B6:23); ʾu-qímli qedàmta, |  la-xəzyàli |  I got up in the morning and did not find her (A26:10-11); qedamta jalde early in the morning.

qeṭana.entry: used to bind together pieces of fabric in clothing.

qɛma.gloss: stand, stake; tree supporting pile of leaves (garuta)

qɛsa.entry: maṛúθa mturáṣtɛwa m-qɛ̀sa |  The snow shovel was made of wood (B5:196); xákma qɛ̀se |  several pieces of wood (A48:2); hóle síqa l-qɛ̀se |  He has come to (fetch) wood (A22:25); xa-qɛ́sa rìxa |  a long piece of wood (A22:26); qəm-maxèle |  ... ʾəṣrá-qɛse gu-xáṣe dìye |  He struck him ten strokes of a stick on his back (A30:14); ʾítle xa-yalə́xta mnuqàšta |  l-bábe zqírta b-qɛ̀se |  He had an embroidered handkerchief, which was woven by his father on the wood (of the loom) (A37:11); qɛsət malka type of wood used for making spoons; qɛsət xu-rušane crutch.

qəbla.gloss: gift dedicated to the church at festivals (usually sheep or goat); meal in church dedicated to the memory of the dead
qəbla.entry: šawwí-qəble qbìlɛle He made seventy donations (A52:2)

qəčča.gloss: short rope tethering an animal to a stake
qəčča.entry: This is shorter than a xawəlta

qəm.entry: forms past perfective of qaṭəl and qaṭəlwa with pronominal suffixes: qəm-qaṭəlle, qəm-qaṭəlwa (§8.6.3.)

qəmmota.gloss: dirt and stones remaining in a sieve after sieving

qənyane.entry: ʾítli bas-xà qənyána |  I have only one animal.

qəppo.entry: smóqe dɛrə́xwalɛ gu-mìye, |  marəθə̀xwalɛ. |  y-áwe qə́ppo b-rèša. |  We would put sumac berries in water and boil them. There was a froth on top. (B10:15)

qəqwana.entry: tré qəqwáne b-xà-kepa maxèwa |  He would kill two birds with one stone (A8:35).

qərda.entry: deθət qərda curative ointment produced from the black resin of this plant

qərrušta.entry: ʾo-xə̀lya |  dáwuqwa qrùšta |  The milk would set (form yoghurt) with a crust (B5:165); qrúšte-diye rába basimtɛ̀wa. |  Its crust was delicious (B5:165); ʾu-màsta |  ʾáxlət mə́nna qrúšta díya t-la-xàrwa |  You should eat the yoghurt without the crust being spoilt (A30:5).

qərša.2.gloss: stalks and remnants of leaves; refuse

qərṭa.entry: y-azə́xwa qə̀rṭa |  We would go and trim (trees) (B5:140); qə́rṭət ʾə̀rwe |  trimming (of trees to feed) small cattle (B5:206).

qərṭala.gloss: pannier bag on the back of an animal
qərṭala.entry: This was made of cane (čiqa thick cane and zala thin cane); mkase qərṭale n.f. late snow falling at the end of March (literally: the coverer of panniers).

qərya.entry: yə́mmi lɛ́wa qrìθa |  My mother was not educated (B8:15).

qəsm.entry: ʾawðánna trè-qəsme |  I shall make it into two parts (A21:28); ʾan-míya pɛ́ši trè-qəsme |  The water will become (divided into) two parts (A24:14).

qəsmətta.entry: xázəx qəsmə̀ttila, |  bálki qàrmən |  Let’s see (whether) I am lucky, perhaps I shall win (A1:4).

qəssa.entry: qə́ssa pìdla |  They have almost passed (A32:23).

qəṣṣət.entry: mòdila qə́ṣṣət? |  What has happened? (A4:11); mə́re mòdila qə́ṣṣət díya? |  mə́ra b-álaha qə́ṣṣət díya hàtxɛla |  He said ‘What is her story? (= What has happened to her)’ She said ‘Well, her story is like this.’ (A4:14); mparqànnux m-áyya qə́ṣṣət |  I shall rid you of this business (A14:1).

qəšta.entry: qəštət marən rainbow; qəšta-w gera bow and arrow.

qəšya.entry: míya píšla qə̀šye |  The water has become thick; ʾay-gə́rðo ʾa-qšìθa, |  ta-duxràne, |  ʾína bušála t-ʾoðə́xwala ṭlàlən, |  xánči miyànta, |  la-ràba |  The gərðo, which is thick, is for church memorial festivals. But the stew, which we made for ourselves, was somewhat watery, though not too much (B10:17).

qəṭla.entry: ʾáwwa záwna t-xzélux dúnye ráya dèwe |  ʾíwa záwnət qə́ṭla-w də́mma-w pràma |  This time when you saw it raining wolves, it was a time of killing, blood and slaughter (A1:24).

qəṭma.entry: ʾáyya məškə́nta píštɛla mxàya |  dráya qə́ṭma gu-réša dìya |  The poor woman began to beat (herself) and put ash on her head (A14:22); qə́ṭma b-rèšux! |  Confound you! (A23:8); qəṭma b-qaṣraθa (putting) ash on cooking pots to clean them

qəṭra.gloss: arch; door arch; stone door frame

qəṭṭa.entry: kúlla wíðəlla qəṭṭàṭe |  He broke them all into pieces (A30:22); qəṭṭaṭət lina šmiṭa shards of a broken pot.

qəθra.entry: qəθrət šeta annual growth ring of tree.

qirθa.entry: generally applied to animals, ʾəzza qirθa a barren goat, tawərta qirθa a barren cow, etc. baxta qirθa a barren women is unusual and a euphemism such as baxta t-lɛ maθya yale a woman who does not bear children is preferred.

qiya.entry: magla qiya a blunt sickle, skinta qiθa a blunt knife

qmaṭa.entry: e.g. the two shafts of a stone roller (mandorta)

qoma.entry: ʾu-ʾan-baxtàθa |  kapšìwale, |  napṣíwale gu-d-a-npàṣta |  ʾu-mattíwale l-qóma báθər xàṣey |  The women would gather it (the rice hay) and shake it with the shaking (just mentioned) and put it into a pile behind their back (B5:85).

qonəx.entry: (1) stage of journey, milestone | qunáxət ṭḷáθa yomáθa qəm-azə́lla b-xamšà daqíqe |  He travelled a stage of three days (journey) in five minutes (A8:39); ʾáp-ʾaw qúnəx ṭḷáθa mə́ṭye l-qàṣra |  and on the third day’s stage (of the journey) they arrived at the palace (A12:11); ʾɛ́kɛle qonàxux? |  Where is your destination?; (2) guesthouse | xa-qúnəx wíðəlle tàza |  He made a beautiful guesthouse (A12:22).; (3) feast, banquent | wúð qunáxa gòṛa |  Make a big feast (A8:89).

qramta.entry: qrámtət šə́rma darmánət bušàla |  The cover of the buttocks is the substance of the stew (D1:13).

qrəmṭa.entry: npílla qrə́mṭe gu-pàθe |  His face has wrinkles

qulčiva.gloss: trigger in the bird trap known as ṱăp̭əkke, ṱăp̭əkθa

qulqulta.entry: These are raised by the key to release the bolt

qulta.entry: This was mostly used to catch foxes and rabbits

qumta.gloss: stature, figure; height (of a man), mound of snow
qumta.entry: qumta zala t-gu-Nērwa Her figure is (that of) a reed in Nerwa (C2:43); θéle tálga b-qumyàθa |  The snow came in mounds (= a great quantity of snow fell); gu-réšət ʾAmedíya y-aθéwa tálga qúmtət bəṛ-nàša |  At the top of Amedia snow used to fall to the height of a man (A25:41); síqɛwa tálga qúrbət tre-qumyàθa |  The snow had almost reached twice the height of a man (B15:38).

quna.entry: ʾo-t-dáwəq nùne |  tárya qùne |  One who catches fishes gets his buttocks wet (D2:26).

qundaxa.gloss: (wooden) butt of a rifle; bullet of a gun

qunjəlta.entry: zílla dwíqla náwba l-ăyàʾha qunjə́lta t-hódəx, |  ʾáyya gu-d-ɛ-qunjə́lta xèta |  They went and kept a guard in that far corner, and one in that other corner (A18:3).

qunjiθa.entry: qunjiyáθe dìye |  d-áy mandòrta |  y-áwa bə̀zye |  The ends of the roller are bored (with holes) (B5:193).

qunya.entry: qəm-darə́tli gu-d-áwwa qùnya |  You have put me in this hole (A14:23); Qučanəs qunye qunye, Mar Šəmʾon t-kulla dunye Qučanəs of wells, wells, Mar Shimon (patriarch) of the whole world (C1:18).

qurba.entry: (1) vicinity | mə́ṭyela l-qúrbət qáṣrət màlka |  They came to the vicinity of the palace of the king (A24:24). Used adverbially: mṭíθɛla qúrbət qàṣra |  He came to the vicinity of the palace (A27:31); ʾə́θyɛle qùrba |  He came up close (A4:55); θéle qùrbi |  He came near to me; qùrbɛwa d-ɛ-xayúθə díyən |  ṱ-i-xăyə́xwala gu-maθwàθa |  It was similar to the life that we lived in the villages (B15:9); ʾan-ṱ-ìla qúrbi qúrbi |  those who are very near me (B11:24).; (2) Attributive adjective (§14.7.): nearby qaṣra qurba a nearby palace, maθa qurba a nearby village.; (3) approximately, about | ʾína palṭíwa qúrbət tre-ṭḷáθa ʾálpe nàše |  About two thousand people would go out (B15:62), ʾáni qúrbət ʾə́ṣra trésər šənnèwa |  They were about ten or twelve years old (B15:32), qúrbət trè-metre |  around two metres (B15:31).

qurbana.entry: y-oðíwa qurbàna |  They would take communion; gu-d-ɛ-dána mšɛríwa wáða rázət qurbàna |  Then they began to perform the communion ceremony (B5:56); qurbánux brìxa! |  Blessed communion (said at a saint’s festival); qurbána mattíwa gu-pummèy |  They would put the communion host in their mouth (B16:16).

qurniθa.entry: line spiqe l-qurniθa The wine jars are empty in the corner (C2:27).

qurša.entry: tálga lɛ́le šmàṭa, |  píšle qùrša |  The snow does not break, it has become frozen; qəm-daríle rəš-qùrša |  They have neglected him (literally: they have put him on the ice).

qurṣəlta.gloss: elbow; square (instrument used in carpentary); bend in chimney pipe on the roof (to prevent rain and snow from entering chimney)

qurṭana.gloss: blanket put on the back of an animal made of compacted wool
qurṭana.entry: a softer blanket known as sarpəšta was put under this

quṣarta.entry: quṣárta xsípla l-pùmma |  bráta plíṭla l-yə̀mma |  A pot has been turned upside down-the girl has come to resemble her mother (D2:35); xošébə bnàθa |  qə́ṭma b-quṣràθa |  On Girls’ Sunday there was (washing) ash in the cooking pots (i.e. the people fasted and washed their pots rather than using them for cooking) (B7:5).

quṣriya.gloss: pot for collecting urine and excrement of baby under a cot

qutana.entry: qutáne blèla |  His shirt was worn out (A37:13)

quṭna kəri.entry: applied as first coating on wall

qutta.gloss: with a short tail or lacking a tail

quwwət.entry: ʾána hon-muθɛ́θa ʾáyya qùwwət láxxa |  I have brought this (military) force here (A25:84).

quwya.entry: xá-dukθa ṱ-íwa qwìθa |  A place that was hard (i.e. had solid foundations) (B15:16); réše qùwyɛle |  He is stubborn; ṭríθa qùwya |  She rode hard (A8:70).

qyamta.entry: šábθa ʾaṣə̀rta |  mrazgíwa gʸána qa-t-ṣálɛ qyàmta |  On Saturday evening they prepared themselves to go down (to church) for the Easter (vigil) (B5:53); dánət plíṭla qyàmta |  The time when the resurrection has come out (point in Easter vigil when Christ’s resurrection is celebrated) (B5:54); qyámtət màrən |  qímle màrən |  The resurrection of our Lord. Our Lord has risen. (Easter blessing by priest to worshippers) (B5:55); bàθər qyámta |  after Easter (B10:2).

raba.entry: (1) much, a lot, many | rába tàlga much snow (B10:47); ʾan-yomáθa ṱ-awéwa ràba séra |  the days when there was a lot of moonlight (B11:3); šúla ràba a lot of work (B5:19); zúze ràba |  a lot of money (A27:18); líθwa šuláne ràba |  There were not many jobs (B11:17). Used independently: ṭla-d-áy dráyɛla xàčča |  ṭla-d-áw ràba |  For herself she pours out a little and for him a lot (A17:25). Intensifier of a verb: ʾáti ràba băyánnux |  I love you a lot (A22:19); ràba xðéle b-d-a-bràta |  ‘He was very happy with the girl’ (A14:96).; (2) very | xa-yála rába šapìra |  a very handsome youth (A25:58); ʾó-lɛša páyəš raqíqa ràba |  The dough becomes very fine (B6:46); basíma ràba (May you be) very well (= Thank you very much). adj. big, abundant, numerous, many | ʾə́θyele xa-máymun ràba |  A big monkey came (A14:45); píšla máθa ràbθa |  It has become a big village (B10:94); ʾíθwa qáṣre ràbe |  There were big villas (B10:52); məndiyáne rábe many things (A27:17); rábe gúṛe y-awðìwala |  Many men (were needed to) make it (B10:79); heywáne ràbe-wawa |  The animals were numerous (A27:36). Used independenly: lɛ́ðiwa ràbe |  Fárxo màṭole |  Many people did not know what Farxo was like (A25:78).

rabbanta.2.gloss: type of black bird with red breast

răbəṭ.entry: qəm-awə́dle rằbəṭ. |  ʾánna t-maxɛ́-răbəṭ, |  rắbəṭ, rắbəṭ kúlla maxèle |  sɛ́pe díye ta-t-la-gàrəš |  He riveted it. (He was one) of those people who did riveting. He riveted all his sword so that he could not draw it (A52:11).

răhan.entry: də̀ryəlla |  ʾar-rằhan |  They made a bet (B19:4)

raḥat.entry: ʾə́θyət ràḥat, |  ʾən-là? |  Have you had a comfortable journey? (A17:6); kúlla heywáne píšla ràḥat |  All the animals were content (A46:4); bàbi |  ràhat! |  My dear, be quiet, calm down (C7:6).

rama.entry: xá-dukθa ràmta |  a high place (A14:87). adv. above | bíš y-awéwa ráḥat ràma |  It was more comfortable above (B5:204); ʾu-ʾáwwa gárewa ràma |  He was high up on the roof (B5:42).

ramana.entry: xa-ṭúra ramàna |  a high mountain (A8:21); ṣáwle ... ramàne |  high(-heeled) shoes (B10:41)

ramša.entry: ramšɛ́xu ṭàwa! |  / ramšɛ́xu brìxta! |  Good evening! ṣloθət ramša evening prayer; xa-ramša evening meal.

ramuθa.entry: xamší-metre ramùθe |  Its height was fifty metres (A25:54).

ranga.entry: čay mare-ranga strong tea; range-range multicoloured; rangət ʾumra place near church in Ɛn Nune where people hold social gathering

rapa.entry: rápət qəqwàne |  a flock of partridges (B5:148); barbiye rape rape The bridesmaids are in flocks and flocks (B8:23).

raqaða.entry: rába raqáðetu You are good dancers (A51:19).

rasa.gloss: tall thick grass used as animal fodder
rasa.entry: šəprət rasa plot of land on which rasa grass is grown; pašxa rase (f.) late snow in the month of Nisan (literally: breaker of rasa grass); ʾo-t-y-awéla ʾə́rwət xwàre, |  yáwilɛ ràsa |  A person who has sheep gives them rasa grass (B5:123).

rašiya.entry: b-núrət rašíye y-áqði məskène |  By the fire of wicked people the poor burn (D2:73).

rašmevi.gloss: type of grape that ripens quickly

raθa.entry: raθət yamne ʾu-raθət čappe the right lung and the left lung

rawðana.entry: ʾắra mxéla rawðàna |  The earth quaked.

raxme.gloss: mercy, compassion (sing. raxma act of mercy)
raxme.entry: ṣléla ráxme gu-lə́bbə d-án polìse |  The policemen felt compassion in their hearts (A8:11); b-raxme! Bless you! (said to somebody who sneezes); yá-babət ràxme |  O father of mercies (addressing God) (A31:6); wúdli xa-ráxma mən-d-àwwa náša |  Perform an act of mercy for me with this man (A31:6).

raxoša.entry: (1) crutch, stilt.; (2) large mixing tool shaped like a crutch

ray.entry: ráyux mòdila? |  What is your opinion? (A27:7).

raza.entry: y-awə́xwa mašmòye |  ʾu-xzàya-w |  qàše-w |  wáða ràze |  We used to listen and see the priests performing the mass (B15:3).

razwana.gloss: machine to frighten away birds in a vineyard or orchard
razwana.entry: This makes a banging noise. It operates by water from an irrigation channel filling a tray. When the water evaporates the arm of the machine rises and hits a tin, which makes a noise.

reša.entry: ʾáw xá-reša m-táma qú-si l-bɛ̀θa. |  He-directly from there get up and go home! (narrative imperatives §15.7.) (A1:19); ṱ-ázəx xa-rèša |  We shall go immediately (B9:15).

reša.2.entry: (1) head (of body)| dríθa xə̀ppo b-réša |  She had put a veil on her head; ʾu-mútte párre gu-rèša |  They have put feathers on their head (B5:47); ʾáyya-ži šōp-rèšux-ila |  That is the place of your head (A24:51). Referring by synecdoche to whole person: réšux ṱ-áwe basìma |  May you (literally: your head) be healthy (said to a person who has been recently bereaved). In oath: b-rèšux |  mó ʾamràna? |  By your head, what should I say? (A26:33).; (2) head (of animals) | mə́ṭyɛle xa-káwtət ʾə̀rwe, |  ʾíbe tre-ṭḷáθa ʾálpa rēš-ʾə̀rwe |  He came to a flock of sheep, in which there were two or three thousand head of sheep (A32:14).; (3) head person, leader (pl. rešane) | rešət maθa village leader.; (4) head (of an instrument) (pl. rešaθa) | rešət maṛa the head of spade.; (5) head (of vegetables) | xá-reša tùma |  a head of garlic (B10:19).; (6) round (of cheese) | Produced by draining in a muslin bag: šqílli mə́nni qə́ṭṭa m-réšət gùpta |  I took with me a piece from the round of cheese.; (7) top, peak, tip (pl. rešăwaθa) | ʾilanɛni t-xabušta m-reša-w šətta mnoqašta Our apple tree is decorated from top to bottom (B8:29); hóla gu-réšət xa-ṭúra ramàna |  She is on the top of a high mountain (A8:21); xazdə́xwa gəllále gu-rešăwaθa bélən bḗl Turkàye |  We would would harvest herbs on the (mountain) tops between us and the Turks; réšə lišáne the tip of his tongue (A45:1).; (8) beginning | Temporal: rešət ṣawma the beginning of the fast. Spatial: málka tíwa gu-rèšət máθa |  The king lived at the top (i.e. beginning) of the village (A25:1).; (9) Idioms: reša xtaya upside down; downhill | réša xtáya kúlle mə̀lxɛle |  Down hill it is all salt (A24:12); ṣlíθɛla reša-xtàya |  She went down head first (A8:76); léwət ʾàti |  ʾɛ-bráta ṱ-in-ʾána wíðəlla gáni k̭óra b-rèšəx |  Are you not the girl on account of whom I made myself blind (A16:7); twíra twíra réše díye m-rēš-d-àyya-wawa |  It was because of her that his head was all broken (A29:29); b-rèšux |  (I swear) by your head (that I am telling the truth) (A22:39).

reša reša.entry: with actions involving movement: har-ʾə́θyɛle mən-ṭúra réša-reša d-o-gàre |  He came straight from the mountain across that roof (A23:14); b-xə́lmi zála reša-réša ða-yáma rába gòṛta, |  yáma xwàrta |  In my dream I went across a great sea, a white sea (A11:7); m-ɛ́ka mɛθə́nne bəzmàre |  ʾu-nasàrta, |  ta-ṱ-oðə́nne gə̀šra |  šàwər réše réše |  From where should I bring you nails and a saw to make him a bridge across which he could jump? (A17:9).

rešaya.entry: zamára rešàya-wewa |  He was a first class singer (A7:6); píšle rešáya gu-máθa ʾàwwa |  He became a leading figure in the village (A39:22); qamáye ʾo-rešáya šaqlə̀xwale |  ta-jùlle |  First we took the best (of the spun wool) for clothes (B1:49); xa-bɛ́θa rába góṛa rešàya |  a large luxurious house.

rexana.entry: qumta rixana balla Her figure is (that of) an erect odiferous basil (C2:44).

reza.entry: kút y-azə́lwa zayə̀nwa, |  píše xá ʾarb-ə́mma xamš-ə́mma náše réza rèza |  Everybody who went would stand, about four or five hundred people, in rows (A8:31); hóla dwíqe kúlla rèza |  They were all standing in a row (A25:29).

rəḥqa.entry: (1) distance | xá-bena xzéle m-rə́ḥqa xá-mdi xwàra |  He suddenly saw in the distance something white (A14:28). Used adverbially: muttɛ́θəlle rə̀ḥqa |  mən-màθa |  She put him down far away from the village (A19:3); rə̀ḥqɛle qáṣra |  The palace is in the distance/is distant (A24:48).; (2) Attributive adjective: distant, far (§14.7.) | qaṣra rəḥqa a distant palace; maθa rəḥqa a distant village.; (3) Idioms: y-azíwa mšamšíwa bɛθ-qòra, |  rə́ḥqa mən-an-dukàne |  They would hold a ceremony in the cemetery-may (death) be far from these places! (formula used when referring to a cemetery or death) (B10:3); šáwpe rə́ḥqa m-áxxa jyára də̀mma |  Pardon me (literally: may its place be far from here)-he was urinating blood (A18:24).

rəmya.entry: rəmyàθa hawetúwa! |  May you be cursed! (A26:27)

rəqqi.entry: dwíqla rə̀qqi |  She insisted (A5:7); ʾáni har-doqíwa rə́qqi ṱ-azìwa |  They still insisted on going (A8:26); bas-ta-rə́qqi b-yawə́nnəx qa-xa-náša špíla gu-tanùra |  but out of stubbornness (= against your will), I am going to give you to a paralysed man (living) in an oven (house) (A40:3).

rəšta.entry: rəšta-w ʾaqle dish consisting of the cooked head and limbs of an animal

rəzyana.gloss: dark in colour (especially colour of walnut peal)

rəzza.entry: rə́zza smòqa |  red rice (cooked with tomatoes) (B5:48); rə́zza y-awéwa ʾo-t-ṭḷàθa |  The rice was the third one (in the degree of fineness, i.e. after the third sieving) (B10:13).

rixa.entry: míxɛle ʾína ríxət xàmra |  He sniffed and smelt the odour of wine (A12:50); kálba šqílle rìxa |  t-xa-kàlləš |  The dog smelt a carcass (C8:5); har-ʾásqən gu-qáṣrət bàbi, |  har-šáqlən rìxa mə́nne |  I shall just go up to my father’s palace, I shall just have a quick look (literally: I shall take a smell of it) (A18:16); šawqíwale l-šə̀mša |  barə́zwa ta-t-là-yawəlwa ríxa |  They left it in the sun to dry, so that it would not give off a smell (B7:20).

romta.entry: xzeli zina rəš-romta I saw a person standing on the hill (C2:55)

roxa.entry: ya-ʾàlaha |  hal-róxa qa-d-ánna náše ṱ-ila píše kèpa |  Oh God, give spirit to these people who have become stone (A8:82); ṣléle róxət qúdša mən-šmáyya The Holy Spirit descended from Heaven (B6:8).

rpapa.entry: rpapət ʾɛna blinking of the eyes; b-xá rpápa mṭéle tàma |  He arrived there in a blink (of the eye).

rpoxa.entry: šəbbaqa rpoxa a loose belt (anton. xloṣa tight)

rubar.entry: rubarət ʾAmediya the river of Amedia (C2:41)

rumxa.entry: məxyále rúmxe díye gu-ṣádrət ʾáwwa Tắtar-i Slemán-i Sə̀ndi |  He drove his spear into the chest of Tătar-i Sleman-i Səndi (A28:36).

rušma.entry: ʾoðíle rúšma ʾax-ṣlìwa |  They make for him a sign like a cross (B6:36).

rušta.gloss: small flat spade (with a head resembling a shoulder blade)
rušta.entry: used, for example, for flattening paddy field basins (məššare)

rzaya.entry: ʾu-čú bəṛ-náša la-máṭe-lla ʾə́lla b-rzáyət gána-diya ṱ-àθya |  Nobody can reach her, but rather she comes of her own will (A8:65); t-la-rzáyət marăwáθa dìya |  without the consent of her parents.

sab.entry: ʾắraq mpalṭə̀xla |  m-yabìše, |  sab-ɛ́-ga xúrme lìθwa táma |  They would produce arak from raisins, because at that time there were no dates there (B5:12); šábθa ʾaṣə̀rta |  mrazgíwa gʸána qa-t-ṣálɛ qyàmta, |  sab-qyámta b-lɛ̀le ʾiyáwa |  On Saturday evening they prepared themselves to go down (to church) for the Easter (vigil), because Easter was at night (B5:53); ʾámər ṭla-mòdi bráti? |  mə́ra sắbab ʾáwwa yàla |  ʾo-t-la-pàləx |  lè y-áxəl |  He said ‘Why, daughter?’ She said ‘Because this young man (has made a rule that) whoever does not work will not eat (A21:29); m-sắbab ʾup-yárxət šáwwa-w tmànya, |  m-bar-sáʾat ʾə̀č̣č̣a b-lɛ́le, |  mšắre xánči qàrθa wáya |  This was because even in July and August, after nine o’clock at night, it started to get rather cold (B15:27).

sadda.gloss: dammed section of paddy field consisting of a row of basins (məššare)

sahðuθa.entry: qa-t-yáwi sahðùθa |  in order to give evidence (B1:18).

sala.entry: used for dairy products, which are kept cool by flow of air

sălămaške.gloss: beehive; cylindrical compartment of beehive (made of basket)

sălamət.entry: ʾáxxa biš-sălàmət-ila |  It is safer here (A30:51).

sălaməttuθa.entry: ʾítli híwi ṱ-áwət sáx ʾu-sălaməttùθa |  I hope you will fine and in good health

saliqa.entry: ṱ-ázi xa-fàtra, |  ʾal-salíqə zòrna |  They went off for a while according to the tune of the pipe (A25:27); máxe zórna xa-salíqa xèna |  He plays another tune on the pipe (A25:27).

salla.entry: sallət čamča basket for storing spoons hanging on the wall

salθa.entry: made of willow (xelapa) and mulberry (tuθa) twigs, chiefly used to refer to(1) small baskets used to keep bees in a beehive and; (2) large baskets used to catch fish in a river.

sama.entry: ʾána sámi t-yánne ṭlalɛ̀xu |  I shall give you my share (A21:29); sama zoda the majority (n.), mostly (adv.): ʾína sáma zóda ʾiyɛ́wala qaràwət |  Most people, however, had a bed (B5:204); ʾima-t-y-aθéwa tàlga |  sáma zóda b-yárxət trè-ʾəsər |  yárxət xà |  when it snowed, mainly in December and January (B5:196).

samma.entry: Zìne |  maštáli sàmma |  Zine will give me poison to drink (A26:85).

samxa.gloss: large post around which vine grows
samxa.entry: used mainly for vines planted in farmland (ʾaqara)

sănayi.entry: lɛ́la senáyi xzàyəlle |  It is not easy to see him; máṣe náša ṱ-ásəq l-gáre b-sănàyi |  A person can easily go onto the roof (B18:2).

sanda.entry: xoθe maxi stune ʾu-ʾap-sanda Under it they will build pillars and a support (C3:10).

santiya.entry: ʾi-maxəlmíwa ʾúpra taqríban xamšì santíye |  They made the (layer of) mud about fifty centimetres thick.

sapiqa.entry: (1) empty | xə́zye ʾína qáṣra sapìqa |  They found that the palace was empty (A12:34); ʾắra ʾiyáwa sapìqta |  The ground was (left) empty (without cultivation) (B5:76).; (2) unoccupied, not busy | ʾɛ́-ga y-áwa bíš sapìqe, |  lá y-awéwa šúla ràba |  Then at that time (in the Autumn) they were more free and there was not much work (B5:19).; (3) riderless (horse) | xə́zyəlle sùsa |  ʾína sapìqa |  They saw that the horse was without a rider (A29:29).

sapoya.entry: xá sapóya ṱ-axlə̀nne |  I shall eat it with one bite (Qaṭina).

saqawa.entry: saqáwa d-ánna susăwàθa |  This water-giver of the horses (A12:59).

sar-amoða.gloss: the first child to be baptized

sarapsɛra.gloss: chain or rope for leading horse

sar-bar.entry: mgabyanni m-gu-sar-barre I would choose for myself (one of them) from the first rows (C2:63)

sardər.entry: sardər tăra the lintel of a door (on the outside of the house)

saṛe.entry: xa dəndəkθət saṛe a grain of barley

sarga.entry: zwína sɛ́rga qam-sùsa |  He has bought the saddle before the horse (D2:14)

sar-gera.gloss: leading ox on the threshing floor
sar-gera.entry: sar-gèra, |  yáʿni ʾáwən majújwala ʾan-tàwre |  The leader, that is it would make the (other) oxen walk around (B5:84).

šărīf.entry: ʾáti rába šărīf-nàšət |  You are a very honourable person (A26:5).

sariqana.entry: hóle sráqa kolána b-sariqàna |  He is raking the street with a rake.

sarmajanke.gloss: small hook of wood connecting the yoke to the beam (mašana) of the plough

sarpəšta.gloss: soft woolen blanket put on back of pack animal under the outer cover known as qurṭana

šarre.entry: tre yalone havrəkke šarreley rəš-mamməkke two rival children are fighting on the breasts (C2:39)

saršoye.gloss: place for washing oneself; large basin for washing dishes

saṭana.entry: saṭána qpìxəlle |  The devil has possessed him; tíwɛle l-súsət saṭàna |  He has become arrogant (literally: He is sitting on the horse of the devil); saṭàne ʾítlən |  We have demons (A22:26); bəjbajət saṭana snail; betət saṭana snail shell.

saṭla.entry: used by milkmaids of sheep: sáṭlət màsta |  bucket of yoghurt (A11:4)

sawa.entry: naša sawa old man; sáwən Tóma grandfather Toma (A50:1); sawət sawən our ancestors; sawăwáθən t-qámθa kúlla tàmɛwa mŭmə́ðe |  All our ancestors of former ages were baptized there (B3:21).

sāx.entry: la-šawqítuley sàxe |  Do not leave them alive (A8:8).

saxora.entry: plíṭle saxóra gu-ʾɛ́ne dìye |  He a sty formed in his eye.

saʾət.entry: sáʾət kəmɛ̀la? |  What time is it?; sáʾət ʾàrbɛla |  It is four o’clock; sáʾət ʾə́ṣra b-lɛ̀le |  ten o’clock at night; sáʾət ʾə́šta mbàdla |  at six in the morning (A6:5); xá-saʾət xèna |  (after) another hour (A9:5); pálgə sàʾa |  half an hour (B6:15).

sela.gloss: concave metal iron griddle for making bread

sela.2.entry: gəšrə Zaxo ramana selət xoθe milana The high bridge of Zakho, the river under it is blue (with grief) (C8:7)

sentimeter.entry: ṭḷáθi sèntimetre ríxa |  thirty centimetres long (B6:55).

sera.entry: sera hadele traṣa the moon is new, sera pišle lăgăna the moon is full (literally: has become a bowl), šəmšət sera moonlight; sera poriyana a bright moon; ʾan-yomáθa ṱ-awéwa ràba séra |  qùwya |  days when the moon was very bright (B11:3).

sere.entry: xáʾa ṱóṱo sère |  an old woman of magic (A27:18)

sɛpa.entry: mxìli xa-sɛ́pa xéna |  Strike me another blow of the sword (A51:18).

səgola.entry: səgoli my dear; ʾazíza səgóli xòna |  my dear brother (A40:1).

səkra.entry: hóle dwáqa sə́kra gu-nèra |  A dam is blocking the river.

səkθa.entry: ʾó-t šawə́rra šáwwa sə̀kke, |  ða-qɛ́θa gu-be-tə̀kke |  He who jumps seven stakes, (one) will hit him in his waist (D2:1).

səllər.entry: ʾaqára hóle dwíqa sə̀llər |  The farm land is hard with frost.

səmbele.entry: səmbelət šəbbəltət saṛe the hairs of a head of barley. Sing. səmbəlta one side of a moustache: kul səmbəlti xa draya Each (side) of my moustache is a cubit (A51:5)

səmmala.gloss: small bundle of grass or produce
səmmala.entry: Four or five səmmale make up a darza large bundle. They are collected in the left hand (cf. C.Syr. semmālā ‘left’) with the sickle (magla) being held in the right.

sənnorta.entry: xə́ṭṭe m-sənnòrta, |  yála m-qapə̀lta |  Wheat (is seen to be good) from when it is a shoot. A child (is seen to be good) from the time of (his mother’s) embrace (D2:36).

səpθa.entry: səppaθət swana the lips of the eaves (of a house)

sərda.gloss: stalks (remaining after leaves are eaten by animals)

sərke.gloss: herb put in jajək (similar to mint)

sərmo.gloss: herb put in jajək and cheese (like chive)

sərra.entry: mṭéla sə́rrə d-áw ṭla-t-šàqəl |  His turn came to take (supplies) (B17:11); náše hóla zíne sə̀rra |  The people are standing (waiting their) turn (B17:10).

sərsərra.gloss: layer of fine white powder put on roof
sərsərra.entry: This is made by sieving white clay (ʾupra xwara)

sərya.entry: šeta sriθa t-lɛla dwiqta daliθa the bad year in which the vine did not yield (fruit) (C2:27).

səryoqe.gloss: stalks of leaves remaining after leaves are eaten by animals → srq

smoqa.entry: šuréle zmírre b-súsa smòqa |  He started to sing to a brown horse (A25:11).

smoqe.entry: ʾilanət smoqe sumac tree, with bunches (qanṭope) of red berries

snoniθa.entry: with a black body and a white breast

solho.entry: wídlɛ sòlho |  They made peace → ṣoloh

sorəkke.gloss: hollowed out open wooden pipe bringing water from a water channel (šaqiθa); gutter of roof; drain pipe

sorəkθa.gloss: lip in the ridge of the lower grindstone of a water-mill where sesame oil pours off

spay.entry: (1) good | hálli xa-súsa spày |  Give me a good horse (A12:62); bábux spày-našɛle, |  xàwrən-ile |  Your father is a good man, he is our friend (A14:61).; (2) well | ʾɛ́ne dìye |  píšela spày |  His eyes became well (A24:21); dàx-it? |  spày-in |  How are you? I am well. adv. well | qa-t-xáyən spáy ʾàxxa |  so that I can live well here (A3:3); qəm-awə́dle rába spày |  He did it very well.

spayuθa.entry: ʾána spayùθən wáða |  I have done good (A14:34); wúð ða-spayúθa mə̀nni |  Do me a favour (A7:17).

spena.entry: ṣṭíple qɛ́sa b-spèna |  He split the wood in the middle with a wedge; naqrə́tla spèna |  You knock in the wedge.

spisa.entry: píšɛle màjbur |  hà-ṱ-ile |  ríxa ʾə́θya mə́nne díye spìsa |  He remained like that, of necessity, until a rotten smell came from him (A27:43).

stərra.entry: contains bags made of dried skins (guðe)

sulaqa.entry: ʾeðət sulaqa Festival of Ascension (40th day after Easter)

suləkθa.entry: e.g. a pipe used to carry sesame oil running off millstones.

sulina.gloss: clay pipe section (several of which are joined together to form a pipe); interlocking section of church roof

sulta.entry: mən-málka ṣála l-sùlta, |  mən-súlta ṣála màlke |  From being king people descend to the dung heap and from the dung heap people rise to be kings (A40:13).

suta.entry: consisting of trap doors over walls made of stone

swana.gloss: overhaning edge of a roof, eaves of roof
swana.entry: swanáne palṭíwa m-gùda |  qa-t-lá-miya ṣále gu-gùda |  The eaves protruded from the wall, so that the water would not run down the wall (B5:191)

swata.entry: ʾu-bxíθa hál swáta dìya |  She wept until she was sated (A8:71)

swire.gloss: stream, small tributary of a river

ṣabun.entry: ṣabun t-raggʸe type of soap made out of gallnuts (apṣe); ṣabunət ʾaqla kneecap

ṣadra.entry: xpáqəlle gu-ṣádra dìya |  She is hugging him to her breast (A4:58); l-ṣadrət gəppa wirwala |  She entered the front of the cave (A51:12); tərte yawne šukraye tiwe ṣadrə be-ḷaye Two white doves sitting in the middle of the upper room (C2:29).

ṣala.gloss: goatskin or lambskin (spread on floor to sit on)

ṣalma.gloss: small bush with small leaves and small sweet red berries; the berries of this bush

ṣamərma.entry: It is gathered in mountains and used as fodder for animals in winter.

ṣanita.entry: ʾáwwa šəbbáqa ṣanìtɛla, |  ṣanítət xanăwàθɛle |  This belt is manufactured, it is a product of looms; lípwalən ṣanìta |  We learnt a skill; ʾáyya xoš-ṣanìtɛla! |  That is a good plan! (A44:3).

ṣapra.entry: only in: ṣloθət ṣapra morning prayer

ṣawma.entry: rēš-ṣàwma |  the beginning of the fast (of Lent) (B5:156)

ṣawməkka.gloss: a man dressed up in sheep skins who goes around the houses of the village at the beginning of the fast of Lent requesting gifts, or a model figure so dressed and carried around the village (B5:156ff., B16:7ff)

ṣawθa.entry: ṣáwθa lɛ̀le mṣawóθe mə́nna díya |  He did not speak to her at all (A21:18); ṣawθət ʾaθuθa the sound of a letter; wéləx hawnànta, |  b-ʾiqárət ṣáwθa basìmta, |  ʾu-màqul |  You have been clever, with the honour of sweet and fine words (A40:16); múrra ṣáwθa xà-gaya xéta |  Repeat what you said again (A25:61); ʾáyya ṣáwθi dū̀s-ila |  What I say is true (A40:4).

ṣɛda.entry: bắyən pálṭən ṣɛ̀da |  I want to go out hunting (A4:1).

ṣəmmaðra.entry: xwarθi ṱ-azəx ṣəmmaðre My friend, let us go (and collect) violets (C2:14).

ṣəmṭa.entry: It consists of jabla and stones.

ṣəppa.gloss: finger; rod protruding from a stone wheel of a roller (mandorta) → ṣabota

ṣəqla.entry: y-oðíwale xa-ṣə̀qla |  They made it a decorative occasion (B5:72).

ṣəṣṣe.entry: These grow in thorny pods. They are eaten as a snack.

ṣəxwa.entry: ṣə̀xwɛla |  It is clear (A34:5); hóle sxáya b-ṣə̀xwe |  He is swimming breast-stroke.

ṣlawa.gloss: tether to tie an animal to a post

ṣləmθa.entry: ṣləmθət paθa facial expression; ṣləmθéy náše gabbàre |  their appearance (was that of) warriors (A8:54).

ṣliwa.entry: y-oðáwa ṣlíwa l-tằra |  She would make (the sign of) the cross (B5:41); y-oðáwa ṣlíwa mə̀šxa |  She (the bride) makes (the sign of) the cross in oil (B5:40).

ṣliwana.entry: wúdli hàtxa |  ṣliwána b-tắrət bɛ̀θa |  Draw a cross for me like this on the door of the house (B8:32).

ṣloθa.entry: ṣloθət ramša evening prayer; ṣlăwaθət xɛle prayers for his strength, blessing prefixed to names of saints: ṣlăwaθət xɛle Mar-Sawa the Blessed St. Sawa.

ṣoloh.entry: wídle ṣóloh mə́nne dìye |  He made a truce with him (A29:62).

ṣopiθa.entry: This contains the oven (tanura), the grindstone (xašolta), the cooking stones (kanuna) and the wash place (saršoye)

ṣoṣinta.gloss: azerole tree; azerole fruit (edible red berry)

ṣoṣiθa.entry: príməlla ṣoṣiyàθa |  they cut their locks (A31:10)

ṣŭbuġ.entry: kúlla mðíta mə́xyəlla ṣŭ̀buġ |  They painted the whole town (A4:34)

ṣudra.entry: ṣudrət lawindiye shirt with long sleeves; ṣudrət xoθa blouse worn under other clothes; ṣudrət jurjēt velvet blouse

šabuða.entry: šabuðət ʾərxe driving rod in water mill that is turned by the propellors, made of willow (xelapa) soaked in grease (tarba); y-oðíwa ... bə́sre-u ... šabùðe |  They would make meat dishes and kebabs (B5:13).

šabuqa.entry: bəska šabuqe t-dawa Her locks are rods of gold (C2:78).

šaðaya.entry: referring to a person doing the carding or the instrument used for carding

šadda.entry: for thread made of cotton (ktana) or gut (gədde)

šadəsta.gloss: pre-wedding party (to which close family and friends are invited)

šaharta.entry: y-awðíwa gáwe díye šahàrta |  They would hold vigil in it (the church) (B2:5); sáma zóda náše y-ázi šahàrta |  Most people went to the vigil (B5:53); šahárta qa-t-qyàmta pálṭa |  the vigil until the resurrection comes out (at Easter) (B5:54).

šala.gloss: shawl, kerchief; sash wrapped around waist
šala.entry: šalət xaṣa back/waist kerchief; šalət qðala neck kerchief; šalət turma type of wide waist sash worn by men (in which a sword is held)

šalila.entry: used for transporting straw from the threshing floor (bədra) to the storage bin (zənja): xánjər l-gótət xáwrux gu-šalílət tùna |  A dagger in the side of your friend (as if) into a basket of straw (D2:41), said when you do not care for your friend.

šalla.gloss: woolen trousers; suit of clothes; type of fabric made from wool
šalla.entry: šalla ʾu-bərmalta trousers and jacket; jullət šalla clothes made of šalla fabric

šămala.entry: plíṭla šămála šắve lhàya |  She came out glowing like a night candle (A38:14).

šambəs.entry: ʾáyya koðə́nta šàmbusila |  This mule is frisky.

šamina.entry: Bɛ́rwər ʾíla xa-ʾàθṛa |  šamìnɛle |  Barwar is a land which is fertile (B1:5).

šana.entry: šanə parxe chickenpox (literally: honeycomb of peeling skin; šanət zarəqte section from a wasps’ nest. This is put in the cage of partridge chicks (pipa), since it contains worms, which the chicks feed on.

šangabí.entry: ṭúrxət šangabí ʾi-ṣáli l-ằra |  The branches of the weeping willow hang down to the ground.

šapira.entry: ʾa-zúrta ràba šapírtɛwa |  The young one was very beautiful (A14:82).

šapna.gloss: instrument for smoothing ground after ploughing and sowing
šapna.entry: This was made of oak twigs (taqanət p̣aṛma). It was connected by ropes to the beam that holds the oxen together (qaṭira); maxe šapna He uses the šapna.

šaqiθa.entry: (1) irrigation channel | l-ay-gōt-hòdəx t-šaqíθa |  the farther side of the channel (A9:1).; (2) groove | šaqyaθa xriṭe gu-xṣipta grooves carved into wooden door lock, for rods (qulqulyaθa) that release and lock the bolt (dawra).; (3) scar | xírre gu-réšət Zàlo |  ʾíθwa šaqyàθa |  brinàne, |  gòṛe rába |  He looked at the head of Zāl (and saw) that there were scars, enormous wounds (A29:3).

šaqla.entry: Such poles are attached to a bier (tirta) and have pieces of cloth (julle) tied between them. They are also used to support the roof of booths (k̭uprane).

šaqola.gloss: lower leg; plumb line (used in building)

šaqqa.gloss: game played with a bat and ball (B11:10ff.)

šaqqana.entry: ʾárya mə́xyəlle šaqqána l-ʾəqər-náθət dèwa |  The lion clouted the wolf on the root of his ear (A42:2).

šarbəṭana.gloss: cane, pliant wooden stick for driving animals
šarbəṭana.entry: usually made of sticks from the pomegranate tree (harmonta); mə́xyəlla ṭḷá šarbəṭáne xéne t-qɛ̀se |  He hit her with three other wooden canes (A24:53)

šarpa.gloss: wrap worn around the neck, extending over front of body

šarṭ.gloss: condition; agreement; test, ordeal, challenge; court case; judgement, sentence; court; custom
šarṭ.entry: (1) condition | ʾaláha hole-mìra |  t-yawə̀llux |  b-šàrṭ |  kú-mdit yawə̀llux |  ta-šwáwux t-yáwəl trè |  God has said that he will give to you on condition that everything he gives to you he will give to your neighbour twofold (A3:4); šŭrūṭ-díyi mkumlìlux? |  Have you fulfilled my conditions? (A12:16); ha-t-dóqət šárṭ mən-d-ò |  nàša |  until you agree on conditions with that man (A12:42).; (2) agreement | wídle šàrṭ |  ta-máxa l-ġðàðe |  He made an agreement that they would strike each other (in a contest) (A52:15).; (3) test, ordeal, challenge | ʾən-šắrəṭ díyi qəm-yăðə̀tla, |  xo-b-gawrànnux |  If you know (the answer to) my test, I shall indeed marry you (A25:62).; (4) court case | ʾitléy šăráṭe ṱ-amríla qa-màlka |  They have cases (to present) to the king (A17:31).; (5) judgement, sentence | šárṭ qázi t-yawə́lla ṭlàlux |  The judge will make a sentence in your favour (A6:7).; (6) court (proceedings) | wírela šarṭ-qàzi |  They entered the court of the judge (A6:9).; (7) custom | w-áxni lìθ gu-šắrəṭ dìyən |  bràta |  krəstyànta |  gáwra mušəlmàna |  But it is not our custom that a Christian girl marries a Muslim (B4:9).

šaša.entry: ʾáwwa mo-ṭɛ́rɛle b-šàša |  What bird is this with a comb? (D1:7)

šata.entry: píšli bēl-šáta l-šəndùxta |  I have come between the plaster and the polishing stone (D2:24), i.e. I am done for.

šăvana.entry: dóqəx šăvàna |  We hire a shepherd (B5:109).

šăve.entry: plíṭla šămála šắve lhàya |  She came out glowing like a night candle (A38:14).

šawpa.entry: ʾánna ʾíla šáwpət ʾaqlaθèy |  These are their footprints; bróna díye šáqəl šáwpe dìye |  bar-d-àw |  His son will take his place after him (A8:2); (b-)šawp-, (b-)šop- adv. in place of, instead of | hálli bə́sra šópət lə̀xma |  Give me meat instead of bread; dáx páyəš málka šáwpət bròni? |  How will he become king in place of my son? (A8:4); pɛ́ša ʾáy ʾàxxa, |  b-šópət brònən |  Let her stay here in place of our son (A4:39); de-puš-šòpux! |  Stay where you are! (A14:20); xə́ṭṭe ... šōp-rə̀zza |  wheat sown after the harvest of rice (B5:95); šlàma-llux |  sáwi šópət bàbi |  Greetings to you, my old man, (you have) a place (like that of) my father (in my respect) (A24:8)

šawwa.entry: ʾurzət šawwa the seventh man; baxtət ʾəšwa the seventh woman; šawwa xaθwaθa Seven Sisters (=the Pleiades constellation)

šawwaθn.entry: base for pronominal suffixes: šawwaθnən the seven of us; šawwaθnɛxu the seven of you; šawwaθnéy the seven of them

šaxina.entry: lə́xma šaxína darmánət náša kpìna |  Hot bread is the medicine of a hungry man (D2:69)

šazada.entry: wírtɛla hátxa ʾína hóle xa-šazáda dmíxa kə́sla dìya! |  She came in like this and there was a prince lying with her! (A4:51)

šaθa.entry: b-xšáwən šáθa doqàli |  I think I have caught a fever.

šera.entry: qímən molə́xmənna ʾánna šére bud-dìye |  I composed these verses about him (C4:3)

šɛna.entry: b-šɛ̀na θélux! |  Welcome; b-šɛ́na b-ṭawàθa! |  Welcome and greetings!; púš b-šɛ̀na! |  Goodbye! xoš-ʾáθya b-šɛ̀na |  She is welcome (A21:10). adj. invar. tame, domesticated; at ease | dawɛ́ra rába šɛ̀nɛle |  A mule is very tame (B5:132); tawə́rta šɛ̀nɛla |  The cow is domesticated (B5:175); ʾu-brōn-díye hádəx píša šɛ̀na mə́nne díye |  His son had become at ease with him (B17:5).

šəbbəlta.entry: bréla xə̀ṭṭe, |  dwíqla šəblàθa |  The wheat grew and bore heads.

šədda.entry: šə́ddət Mar-ʾOdíšo ṱ-áθya ʾəllɛ̀xu |  The demon of Lord Jesus will come to you (said to a child as a warning); qəm-maxyála šə̀dda |  A demon has hit her, qəm-qapxála šə̀dda |  A demon has possessed her (said of a woman who is afraid or acts emotionally).

šəkkuθa.entry: kəmət jawja b-ʾašəquθa naše nabli šəkkuθa Whenever she moves coquettishly, people become suspicious (C2:73)

šəkla.entry: yə́mmi ðítəlla b-šə́klɛ Bedwàye wɛ́wa |  My mother knew that they were from Bedu by their appearance (B9:5); xírre qəm-xazéle šə́kle díye tàma |  He looked and saw his own image there (A46:4); šqílli šə́kla dìya |  I took a picture of it (B3:21); ʾən-bắyət šə̀kla, |  ʾíttən šə́klət vìdeo |  If you want a picture, we have a video film (B15:93).

šəklana.entry: mən-yóma qamáyə brèla, |  ʾatxa-jwànqe-wɛwa, |  ʾatxa-spáy ʾátxa šəkláne ʾu-xə̀lye |  From the first day (after) they were born, they were so beautiful, so fine, so bonny and sweet (A8:6); rába šəklánta ʾiyáwa basìmta |  It (the occasion) was very beautiful and pleasant (B5:55); ṣáwθa gu-púmmət màrɛla šəklánta |  A word is beautiful in the mouth of its master (= It is easier said than done) (A26:40); ʾən-bábux ʾu-yə́mmux gu-bɛ̀θɛla, |  lɛ́la šəklánta ṱ-ásqət l-gàre |  If your father and mother are in the house, it is not pleasant for you to go up onto the roof (D2:7).

šəkloka.gloss: loose stitch used to join pieces of fabric together in a preliminary fashion before they are sewed with the final stiching

šəkθa.entry: The plural form šəkke is restricted to the insect name taqla šəkke spider (literally: weigher of testicles).

šəlloxta.gloss: shed skin of a snake; husk of grain
šəlloxta.entry: ʾɛ-šəllóxte díye šaqlə̀xwala |  We would remove that husk (B16:30).

šəlxa.entry: dabaše šəlxa mubrela The bees have made a swarm.

šəmma.entry: ʾáw múttəlle šə́mme díye Mar-Sàwa |  They named it (the church) St. Sawa (B6:30); ʾáti šə́mmux zìlɛle |  You are famous (A12:10); ʾƐ̄́n Núne b-šə̀mmɛwa Ɛn Nune was famous; šə́myəx b-šămáθə šə̀mmux |  We have heard about you (A12:12); ʾálaha šuxa-l-šə́mme God, praise be to his name (A6:10); yalúnka zòra-wewa b-šə́mma |  ʾína ʾáp-aw ferə̀ssa-wewa |  He was a young child in name (only), but (in fact) he also was a great warrior (A29:25).

šəmme.entry: marginal, the normal form is šmayya

šəmməšta.gloss: bark from juniper (daprana) or vine (daliθa) used as tinder

šəmra.entry: síqɛle xákma mən-d-ò-šəmra, |  wírɛle gu-naxírət xa-m-malàxe |  Some of the soot went up and entered the nose of one of the angels (A4:60).

šəmša.entry: šə́mša gnèla |  The sun set; šə́mša xrùle |  The sun was eclipsed; šə́mša qəm-băléla ḥùta |  A whale has swallowed the sun (i.e. it is eclipsed); šəmšət sera moonlight; mattíle qam-šə̀mša, |  ʾi-bàrəz |  They put it in the sun and it dries (B6:43); ʾáwwa málla ṱ-axə́lla kθɛ̀θa |  ʾána bṱ-ázən gu-šə̀mša |  This mullah will eat the chicken and I shall go without food (A2:4).

šəndoxa.entry: dɛréle ʾo-šəndòxa |  b-xùwwe |  qá-t qaṭə̀lle xúwwe |  He threw the stone at the snake, to kill the snake (A1:15).

šənduxta.entry: used for smoothing plaster; píšli bēl-šáta l-šəndùxta |  I have come between the plaster and the polishing stone (D2:24), i.e. I am done for.

šənqa.entry: This is a component of vegetables such as maše, faṣuliye, lubye, gasose.

šənθa.entry: šənθux θàyɛla? Are you sleepy?; ʾɛ́ka ṱ-áθya šə̀nθe?! |  hal-qedámta šə́nθe la-θèla |  How could he sleep!? Right up to the early morning he did not sleep. (A6:3); qəm-ganwàle šə́nθa, |  ṭlìle |  Sleep stole him away and he slept (A26:19).

šəppola.entry: šəppolət ṣudra the edge of the shirt.

šəpra.entry: šəprət rasa an area of land on which rasa grass grows

šəqqana.entry: qəm-maxə́nne xa-šəqqàna |  I slapped him (synon. zərana)

šəqraqa.gloss: small green bird that eats bees

šərma.entry: The plural is used to refer to the two halves of the buttocks). maqðə́xwa šə́rmət ʾÙšwuṭ |  We used to burn the buttocks of February (festivity at the end of winter in which a bonfire is lit → məlməlawa); šərmət qamṣa back of grasshopper fed to chick partridges when kept in a cage (→ pipa); qrámtət šə́rma darmánət bušàla |  The cover of the buttocks is the substance of the stew (i.e. the fat of the sheep’s tail) (D1:13).

šəryoxa.entry: used to to tie up sheepskin boots (zargule) and the mouth of leather storage bags (mziðe); šəryóxa báθər mzìða |  (There is) a chord behind the bag (said of a man who is the puppet of his master) (D2:18). Also used to tie the collar of oxen that are pulling the plough.

šəšxana.gloss: old type of rifle (loaded from the barrel)

šətrənje.entry: šúryela mṭawóle b-šətrənjàne |  They started playing chess (A26:63)

šəṭrana.entry: ʾítli ðá bratət-màma, |  hádəx-ila šṭrànta |  max-d-àwwa yóma |  I have a cousin, who is as beautiful as this sun (A7:17); y-awə́ðwala šṭràne |  He used to make them (the spoons) beautiful (B10:100); ṭliba lɛle šəṭrana Her betrothed is not handsome (C2:57); šəṭrantux ʾɛna zroqe Your sweetheart- her eyes are blue (C2:33).

šəṭro.entry: šəṭro marθət habriya the beautiful woman who possesses the headscarf (C2:1); šətro šuṭarta lali Beautiful one, sweet-heart of mine (C2:7).

šətta.entry: šəttət linta the bottom of a jar; šə́ttət màθa-wewa tíwa ʾo-xóna făqíra |  The poor brother lived at the bottom of the village (A25:1); maṣə́lyannux šə́ttət yamàθa |  I shall take you down to the bottom of the seas (A12:28); ʾilanɛni t-xabušta m-reša-w šətta mnoqašta Our apple tree is decorated from top to bottom (B8:29); qəm-daryále gu-xa-gunìya |  šə́tta díya nčìlta |  She put it in a sack the bottom of which was torn (A34:17).

šətya.entry: → maštoye to arrange threads on warp beam

šəxta.entry: šəxtət naθyaθa ear wax; bar-hàdəx, |  y-aθɛ́wa mdarɛ̀wale |  qa-t-lá-hawa píše šə̀xte |  Then they would come and winnow it, so that impurities did not remain (B5:86); mítla m-šə̀xta |  She has died with dirt (= she is terribly dirty) (A27:24).

šima.entry: hay šima-lən a catastrophe has come upon us (A51:8)

šima.2.entry: θélən b-áwwa ṭúra šìma |  We came to this huge mountain (A17:10); ʾan-ʾə́rwe šìme |  those numerous sheep (A32:16)

šipa.entry: šipət topaθa a volley of rifles

šira.gloss: milk; sap (of tree), resin (of plants); paint
šira.entry: ṣawe šira guda He paints the wall.

šiša.entry: šišət qɛsa the iron tip of a wooden stick; šíšət bə̀sra |  meat kebabs (B10:6).

šišmanta.entry: used as kindling for a fire and also for stopping up holes in a wicker screen (B10:65)

škăra.entry: xə́zwa škằra wéwa |  It was a clear vision (A2:6); mṣáwəθ škằra! |  Speak clearly!; gu-lə́bbət gàne márəlla |  lɛ́le-marəlla škằra |  He says it to himself, he does not say it openly; lɛ̀le xə́lma, |  škằrɛla |  It is not a dream, it is real (A4:8); mə́ndi ṭə́šwa bət-páyəš škằra |  any hidden thing will be uncovered (A38:15).

škira.entry: škíra ʾaláha díya bsìmla |  Thank God she has now recovered (A4:26); škíra šə́mmux ya-ʾàlaha |  Praise be your name, oh God (A9:4).

šlama.entry: šlama-llux greetings to you; də́ryəlle šláma l-xa-báxta tàma |  He greeted a woman there (B17:2).

šliθa.gloss: membrane of new-born calf that is ejected from the body by a cow when giving birth; sloughed skin of a snake

šmayya.entry: šmáyya ʾíla denánta ṭla-ʾắra tə́rte qərṭále t-ʾə̀pra |  Heaven owes the Earth two baskets of dust (the graves of Noah and Elijah) (D2:9); síqle l-šmàyya |  He went up to heaven (A1:27).

šmɛθa.entry: šə́myəx b-šămáθə šə̀mmux |  We have heard about you (A12:12).

šoramiṭa.entry: hóle xa-šoramíṭa m-áxxa l-tămàha |  dmíxa kə́sla dìya |  A giant from here to there (in size) is lying with her (A4:52).

šraʾa.entry: də-yamyannux b-ʾayya šraya I swear to you by this lamp (C2:81)

šrape.entry: hóla ráya dúnye šràpe |  It is sleeting

šukraya.entry: tərte yawne šukraye tiwe ṣadrə be-ḷaye Two white doves sitting in the middle of the upper room (C2:29).

šula.entry: ʾɛ́-gət mən-d-ánna hàwe, |  šúla bṱ-ázəl la-qàma! |  If there are these (gold pieces), the job will go ahead! (A4:15); wíðta šùlɛla ṱóṱo |  The old woman made (good) business (A4:22); ʾítli šùla |  I have something to do (A4:22); ʾítli xáčča šùla mə́nnux |  I have some business with you (A16:4); ʾáti lítləx šùla |  It is not your business (A5:2); mur-ʾána šə́mmi Čùxole |  ʾu-lìtlux šúla |  Say ‘My name is Čuxo’ and you will have no trouble (A7:18); ʾɛ-dánə ṱ-íle wíðəlle ʾáwwa šùla |  When he did this thing ... (A29:48)

šumuθa.entry: ʾáw hóle wáða šumùθa |  He is behaving badly

šuqa.entry: gắrəg ʾázət šùqa |  You must go to the market (A40:6)

šura.entry: šúrə d-o-qàṣra |  the wall of the palace (A25:53).

šuraye.gloss: in the beginning, first of all
šuraye.entry: šùraye |  y-azə̀xwa |  ... l-bɛ̄θ-be-kʸàlo |  First of all we would go ... to the house of the bride’s family (B5:1).

šurela.gloss: party of close family after wedding

šuša.entry: šušət panjăriya window pane; xa-šùša |  a piece of glass (B11:20)

šut.entry: ʾən-maṣya šut-ʾoðala If she can, let her do it (C1:11); šút la-ʾàθe! |  Let him not come!

šuxa.entry: ʾálaha šuxa-l-šə́mme God, praise be to his name (A6:10)

šuxra.entry: y-aθéwa šùxra |  It would come by commissioned transport (B5:126).

šwalta.gloss: edible herb that produces glue; the glue extracted from this herb
šwalta.entry: It turns yellow when cooked in rice

swata.2.entry: yəmma baxya swata Let her mother have a surfeit of weeping (C1:23)

šwawa.entry: zílɛwa be-šwàwe |  He had gone to the neighbour’s house (A22:32).

šwiθa.entry: qedámta xzíθəlla gʸána gu-šwiyáθət gʸàna |  In the morning she found herself in her own bed (A4:14); šəwyáθa sằfări travelling beds (A8:51).

tabura.entry: ʾu-ʾanna jwanqe tabure and these young men are in squadrons (C1:21)

tabura.2.entry: la duqrula qalulta kriθa, xliθa, taburta Do not consider her to be small short, sweet and submissive (C2:74).

tagbarta.entry: ʾáxni xoθ-tagbártət màlkəx |  We are under the administration of the king (A8:80).

tagbir.entry: qímla wídla tàgbir |  They made a plan (A26:1)

tăhər.entry: xa-tắhər t-šəkwána a type of ant; kùt-tăhər t-bắyitu |  every kind you want (A7:23); kúl xa-tắhər mə́ndi ʾítle gàwa |  He had every kind of thing in it (the shop) (A22:18); mò-tăhər nášɛle? |  What kind of person is he? (A25:31).

tajəruθa.entry: sáwi y-awúðwa təjarùθa |  mən-ʾAšìθa |  My grandfather would conduct trade with Ashitha (B3:4); zíltənwa tajərúθa tàma |  I went on business there (A35:9); tajərúθət bàbux |  kút-ṭla šə́nne xa-béna y-áθya làxxa |  The merchants of your father come here every three years (A14:61).

talən.entry: mə́xyət tàlən |  bážər dìyən |  You have plundered our town (A52:14).

talga.entry: ráya tàlga |  It is snowing; θéle tálga xa-θɛ̀θa |  It snowed heavily (A25:41); ʾu-míya ṣáli bíye díye páyəš tàlga |  The water flows down it and becomes ice (B19:3).

tali.entry: ʾáyya táli dìyila |  This is the end of me (A8:58).

talila.entry: julla talila a wet cloth; dánət talìla y-áwe, |  y-áwe dwìqa |  When it (the pile of leaves) is fresh, it is compact (B5:119).

tama.entry: Used to refer anaphorically to a location out of sight of speech situation: bálki lá-hawe tàma |  Perhaps he will not be there (A1:10); sab-ɛ́-ga xúrme lìθwa táma |  since at that time there were no dates there (in Barwar) (B5:12); táxtɛla mútte hàtxa |  ta-ṣáli tàma |  They have put a board like this in order to go down there (A22:10). Repeated to express movement: ʾan-tre-maláxe ... θéla pyáða táma tàma |  Those two angels ... came passing by (A4:44); ʾáw brōn-málka θéle jwája tam-tàma |  The son of the king came walking along there (A8:14). Temporal sense in expression m-tama hodəx from then onwards, afterwards: xárθa m-táma hòdəx, |  xɛ̀ri |  ʾína bɛ́θe díye kúlle qìða |  Then, afterwards they look and see that all his house had burnt down (A48:7).

tămaha.entry: də́ryəlla gu-qaṣxàne |  ʾu-múttəlla tămàha |  He put them (the bones) in the pan and put it aside (A2:5); hóle xa-šoramíṭa m-áxxa l-tămàha |  dmíxa kə́sla dìya |  A giant from here to there (in size) is lying with her (A4:52).

tămaʾha.entry: ʾu-xá-kepa muttɛ́θəlle tămàʾha |  She put a stone far away over there (A25:17); tu-tămàʾha! |  Sit way over there! (A25:17).

tăməz.entry: ʾíθ dukáne tắməz y-áwa ṭla-zrùta |  There are places that are clear for sowing (B5:94).

tamma.entry: ʾáyya xá-šeta hóla támma láxxa lɛ́la mbaqorə̀llux |  It has been a year that they have been here without asking for you (A26:78); ʾu-táwra píšle mangóle ʾáxxa l-tàmma |  The ox began to limp back and forth (A22:3); qedámta qímtɛla bràta-w |  mxŭláltəlla ʾay-dùkθa |  ʾáxxa-w tàmma |  In the morning the girl got up and cleaned the place, and so forth (A17:27)/

tăna.entry: lə́bbi píšle tằna |  I was relieved

taniθa.entry: This was used to hang washing or to hang pieces of meat to dry

tannəkka.entry: ṭḷà tannə́kke míya |  three gallons of water (B5:211)

tanura.gloss: oven (for baking bread); section of women’s blouse (ṣudra) that covers the legs

taqa.entry: ʾáyya tunìθən |  mšaxlə́ppa mən-d-áwwa tàqa, |  ṱ-áza l-xa-táqa xèna hadíya |  Now, our story will change from this branch and go to another branch (A8:20); y-oðə́xwa ṭḷáθa táqe naqìðe We would make three thin strands (of wool by spinning) (B10:46)

tăra.gloss: door; leaf of large door (darga); beginning
tăra.entry: dárga ʾítle tré tăràne |  A darga has two leaves; ʾu-náše mapəlxìwala |  hal-tắrət sə̀twa |  People would use it until the beginning of winter (B5:171).

tarəkka.entry: ʾawə́dla tarə̀kka šáwpa díya |  He made her into a corpse (A30:33).

tarəqta.entry: tráqəlle b-tarə̀qta |  He is buttoning it up.

tăreθa.gloss: small door or opening in fence or hedge; oesophagus; small mountain pass

tar-ʾIšo.gloss: a type of edible plant that grows in water

tata.entry: tatət parre comb of feathers; tatət bəsra comb of skin

tawərta.entry: tawərti ʾa-Ġazale my cow called Ġazale.

tawra.entry: tawri ʾo-Xammo my ox called Xammo

tawuzra.entry: It is boiled and mixed with sumac berries (smoqe)

taxe.entry: šmili xa qalət zəmra l-a-taxət baθər ʾumra I heard the sound of song in the neighbourhood beyond the church (C2:6)

taxərta.gloss: small pitta bread cooked on the side of oven
taxərta.entry: a larger form of this is called zeðaya

taxmanta.entry: háyyo xázəx mhàyərri |  bəd-taxmàntux |  Come, let’s see whether you can help me with any ideas (A21:2).

taxta.entry: (1) board | mátti táxta hàtxa |  ... ta-ṣáli gu-gòma |  They would lay down a board like this ... in order to go down into the basement stable (A22:10).; (2) wooden bed | damxə́xwa b-gáre b-qɛ̀ṭa. |  ... kút-xa-w táxte dìye, |  táxtət qɛ̀sa |  We would sleep on the roof in summer ... everybody (would go up) with his bed, with his wooden bed (B10:58).; (3) throne | brōn-málka tíwɛle l-d-a-tàxta |  The son of the king sat on the throne (A14:43).

taza.entry: xáyūθ-diye rába tàzɛyawa |  His life was very good (B5:132); xmárte díye msúrgəlla-w wíðəlla tàza |  He had saddled his donkey and made it smart (A6:6); barə́zwa tàza |  It became thoroughly dry (B5:88).

tazi.entry: hadíya gu-bɛ́θən tàzila |  Now our house is in mourning; bássa wuð-tàzi |  Do not mourn any more! (A26:88).

təksa.entry: dabáša máxe tə̀ksa |  A bee stings.

təngər.entry: hóle θéle téla tə́ngər tə̀ngər |  Then the fox came, limping (A35:18)

tənna.entry: gu-yáma plíṭle xa-tə̀nna |  A plume of smoke came out of the sea (A13:10)

təqna.entry: gáwət ṭína ʾu-tə̀qna |  in the mud and grime (A27:28)

tərwəθ.entry: base for pronominal suffixes: tərwəθnən the two of us; tərwəθnɛxu the two of you; tərwəθnéy the two of them.

təxrunya.entry: ʾáxči ʾána təxrúnya dìyi |  xə́zyɛn núne zòre |  I have seen, as far as I remember, only small fish (B3:8); xa-təxrúnya d-ó qadìša |  a memorial of the saint (B5:69).

təxruθa.entry: kúlla xaràye, |  təxrùθi, |  plìlɛni |  In the end, I remember, we all separated (B8:9).

tiraka.entry: used as a spool for thread; used with metal tips as a component of a partridge trap (suta ↓) holding up the trap doors (dapyaθa).

tirta.gloss: bier, stretcher for carrying a corpse
tirta.entry: It consists of two carrying poles (šaqle) between which are tied pieces of cloth (julle).

tita.gloss: silver tassel decorating head of a woman; small chain hanging from belt or bracelet

t-la.entry: With nominal complement: t-la-zùze |  without money (A24:23); t-lá mìya |  without water (B5:14); t-lá d-o-náša without that man; t-la-díyi without me. With an infinitive: zeðàye |  ʾáxlət mə́nna t-là-qṣaya |  You should eat the pittas without breaking them. (A30:5); ʾáni xə́ṭṭe huwèdi sáma zóda |  ʾi-zăríla t-là maštóye |  The huwedi wheat they generally sow without irrigating (B5:94); qímɛle jálde madə́nxa t-la-mxàya |  He rose early while the dawn was not breaking (= before dawn broke) (A8:51); qəm-dári ʾan-dáwwe heš-t-là bráza |  They have poured out the dawwe without it yet being dry (B14:1).

tmanya.entry: ʾurzət tmanya the eighth man; baxtət tmane the eighth woman.

tmanyaθn.entry: base for pronominal suffixes: tmanyaθnən the eight of us; tmanyaθnɛxu the eight of you; tmanyaθnéy the eight of them

to.entry: hár-to bàθri |  Still come after me = Follow me further (A32:19).
