tola.entry: ṱ-ázən šáqlən tólət bàbi |  I shall go to take revenge for my father (A28:8); šqílla toléy xa-b-ʾə̀ṣra |  They took their revenge ten times over (B3:14).

tope.entry: dɛríwa topàθa |  They would fire guns (B10:34); ʾaw-mə́xyəlla tópe gu-ṣádrət ʾàxa |  He shot his gun at the chest of the agha.

tos.entry: ʾánna xéne kúlla hóla tíwta tos-ʾə̀lla Dust had settled on all the others (A8:56)

trab.entry: ʾu-Gozáli tíwɛle tràb xaṣ-súsa |  Gozali sat-thud-on the back of the horse (A8:39).

trapθa.entry: trapθət ʾɛne blinking of the eyes; qəm-awə́dle b-trápθət ʾɛ̀ne |  He did it before you could bat an eyelid.

traθn.entry: base for pronominal suffixes: traθnən the two of us; traθnɛxu the two of you; traθnéy the two of them.

tre.entry: ʾína qəm-xazə́nnəx ʾáti rába hawnànta, |  biš-mə́nni xa-tə̀rte |  I see that you are very clever, twice as much as me (A40:16); yómət trè on the second day (A21:14); ʾu-də-trè |  and secondly, and moreover (B5:3).

tŭtur.entry: tŭtur ṱ-abresəm silk worm (which feeds on the mulberry tree tuθa)

tuθa.entry: Types of tree include: tuθa qazbi large white berry, tuθa turka small yellow mulberry, tuθa č̣uwa smooth mulberry, tuθət burane field mulberry, tuθət ʾərxe mill mulberry.

tuθta.entry: Types of berry include: tuθe xware white mulberries and tuθe kome black mulberries. The latter type is also know as tuθə šemaye or tuθə šemi Syrian mulberries. tuθe karrəkke unripe mulberries; tuθta karrəkθa an unripe mulberry.

txo.gloss: under (archaic form of xo- only found in proverbs)
txo.entry: ʾíði txo-kèpɛla |  My hand is under a stone (D2:20); míya txo-tùna |  (He is like) water under straw (D2:42).

ṱanga.gloss: saddle-girth, strap used to secure the cloth (qurṭana) on the back of an animal
ṱanga.entry: This was threaded through a metal ring.

ṱaražoke.entry: It builds its nests in the eaves of houses

ṱarra.entry: xánči halúke ṱàrre |  some fresh plums (B8:19)

ṱok̭e.gloss: small bird with a distinctive song

ṱoṱo.entry: ʾítlən ða-ṱóṱo y-óða xə̀rše |  We have an old woman who does magic (A4:13); ṱoṱi my grandmother; kɛ̀la ṱóṱo? |  Where is grandma? (A7:24).

ṱurk̭a.entry: It is treated in this way in order that it produces twigs and wood for construction rather than fruit

ṱušṱirta.gloss: two- to three-year old female goat

ṭabəq.entry: músqəlla gu-ṭábaq t-ṭḷàθa |  He took her up to the third floor (A4:37); ṭabaq ḷaya upper room; ʾáwwa mən-tre-ṭabàqewa bɛ́θe díye |  His house consisted of two storeys (B15:20).

ṭalana.gloss: side of mountains in Barwar that remains in the shade at sunrise
ṭalana.entry: guði t-ʾəzzi d-ɛ-poše gu-ṭalana mxarpoše My churn (made) from my goat called ‘white spotted,’ which looked for food on the shady mountain (C5:3).

ṭali.entry: b-ṭali ill (with disease) | brōn-málka píšle b-ṭàli |  The son of the king became ill (A8:32).

ṭalobaya.gloss: a person who performs ṭalobe (requesting of the hand of a girl in marriage)

ṭana.entry: mxaya ṭane l- to make critical innuendoes against

ṭapṭapa.gloss: small round unleavened bread on a griddle (sela)
ṭapṭapa.entry: ʾáw ṭapṭàpɛle |  He is (like) unleavened bread (i.e. he lacks something).

ṭarma.entry: ṱ-awrəx xo-ṭármət ʾisàra |  Let’s shelter under the rock.

ṭarpa.entry: ʾo-t-hawéle ʾə̀rwe |  y-áwe xzida ṭàrpa |  A person who has sheep would have harvested leaves (B5:108); hóle zíla ṭàrpa |  He has gone to collect leaves.

ṭarxa.gloss: new shoot in a plant or tree
ṭarxa.entry: ʾilána hóle mṭaróxe ṭàrxe |  The tree is putting out shoots.

ṭasa.entry: xa-ṭásət dàwa |  a golden bowl (A15:11); xa-ṭásət mìya |  a bowl of water (A26:42).

ṭawa.entry: ʾáwwa náša sáwa rába ṭàwa-wewa |  This old man was very good (A15:19); ramšɛ́xu ṭàwa |  Good evening (ramša f.), ʾɛ́we ʾən-θéla m-la-Zàwa, |  ṱ-áθe xa-yóma ṭàwa. |  ʾən-ʾɛ́we θéla m-Xawòra, |  ṱ-áθe xa-yóma kapòra. |  If the clouds come from the side of the Zab (i.e. the East), a good day will come. If the clouds come from the Khabur (i.e. the West), an awful day will come. (D2:16); nə́mu ʾánna là-biš ṭáwe m-áwwa Gozáli xóni! |  Surely they are not better than Gozali, my brother! (A8:72); ʾay m-kulley buš ṭawa She is the best of all (C2:42).

ṭawalta.entry: lá-kulla danáne kúlla ṭawalyáθa ṱ-aθíwa mṭawòle |  Not all games would be played at all times (B11:1).

ṭawpana.entry: dúnye hóla ráya ṭawpàna |  There is heavy rain.

ṭaxa.gloss: pile, untied bundle (of grass and leaves)
ṭaxa.entry: This was compressed with stones in order to faciliate it being carried as a bundle: ʾan-xéne ʾiyáwa báθre báθre wáða ṭàxe |  zóre qa-t máṣi mjămɛ̀wala |  The others were following behind him making small piles, so that they could gather them up (B5:118). Cf. darza tied bundle.

ṭaya.gloss: leaf (of a plant); leafy branch (of a tree)

ṭera.entry: dān ṭera noontime, dárta l-yòma, |  ʾə́rwe gu-gòma. |  dárta l-sèra, |  ʾə́rwe l-ṭèra |  If the sun has a halo, the sheep will be in the basement stable. If the moon has a halo, the sheep will be in the noonday sun. (D2:15)

ṭɛnana.entry: ʾána ṭɛnánət mə̀ntɛwən |  You have done me a favour (I am much obliged to you).

ṭəlla.entry: ṭəlla ʾamurta deep shade, ṭəlla dalilta light shade (with some sun shining through)

ṭəpra.entry: hóle qráṭa ṭəpràθe |  He is biting his nails; ṭəppəryáθət heywàne |  animal claws (A19:2).

ṭəšwa.entry: mə́ndi ṭə́šwa bət-páyəš škằra |  any hidden thing will be uncovered (A38:15)

ṭina.entry: ʾáni qámθa báte bə́nye b-képa-w ṭìna |  In the old days houses were built with stone and mud (B5:179)

ṭina.2.entry: baxta ṭinta a pregnant woman; guði ... măyale ʾɛ-baxta ṭinta My churn ... which that pregnant woman churns (C5:4)

ṭiyariyana.entry: júlle ṭiyariyàne lóšiwa |  They used to wear Ṭiyare clothes (B8:22).

ṭiza.entry: xá ʾaxwáθi mìra |  dráya šlámi ʾə̀llux |  ʾu-ʾáti tíwa l-ṭìzux! |  A prince like me greets you and you are sitting on your bum! (A26:48)

ṭlaba.entry: t-yawəllux kulla ṭlabe He will give you all requests (C4:5).

ṭlawxe.entry: xa dandəkθət ṭlawxe a lentil seed

ṭḷaθa.entry: ʾurzət ṭḷaθa the third man; baxtət ṭəḷḷəθ the third woman

ṭḷaθn.entry: base for pronominal suffixes: ṭḷaθnən the three of us; ṭḷaθnɛxu the three of you; ṭḷaθnéy the three of them; ṭḷáθna t-bnóne dìye |  His three sons (A24:3)

ṭolaza.entry: šəṭro ṭolaze baθra npile (My) beautiful one (lover)-young men followed after her (C2:30).

ṭunta.entry: ʾímət mṭéla ṭúnte dìye |  When its fruit became ripe (A17:33); bíš yáwi ṭúnta ràbθa |  They will yield more abundant fruit (B5:103).

ṭura.entry: rešət ṭura summit of a mountain; palgət ṭura middle, foothills of a mountain; bắyən pálṭən ṣɛ̀da, |  ʾána ʾu-xuràne, |  gu-ṭùra |  I want to go out hunting, I together with friends, in the mountains (A4:1).

ṭŭši-ṭŭšo.gloss: the game of hide-and-seek (B11:12ff.) → ṭappu, puq-əlli

ṭuwa.entry: ʾən-ṭúwət ʾisə́qθi bdìlɛle, |  mšadrátla ʾárye ṱ-àθa |  If the gem of my ring changes (in colour), send the lions so that they come (to me) (A18:13).

ṭuwe.entry: ṭúwe l-d-o-yòma |  How fortunate was that day. if only | ṭúwe t-xazə̀nwale! |  If only I had seen him!; ṭuwe t-baryawa šarre If only there would be war! (C2:63); ṭuwe t-pɛšanwa nəšra If only I were to become an eagle (C3:2); ṭúwe l-ó yòma, |  b-xazə́nnəx ʾáti ʾɛ̀ni b-gáwrət |  I look forward to the day when I see who you will marry (A25:18).

θani.entry: θáni yómət ʾéða the second day of the festival (B10:2)

θəqa.entry: lítlux θə́qa bìyi |  You do not trust me (A12:40)

w.entry: Connective between clauses (§18.1.1.): ʾáti tú-tiwa làxxa |  ʾu-súsi páyəš làxxa |  ʾu-ʾána bráta masqə́nna be-bába dìya |  You stay here and my horse will stay here and I shall take the girl up to the house of her father (A29:41); ʾo-yálət băyàwale |  hóle ʾə̀θya-w |  qəm-yawə́lla yalə̀xθa ʾə́lli |  The young man whom she loved has come and has given me her scarf (A4:24). Connective between nouns in a nominal phrase (§14.11.): xá-yoma ʾíθwa xá-qaša ʾu-xà-malla |  Once there was a priest and a mullah (A2:1); lát-xila xa-lə́xma-w xa-bèta? |  Have you not eaten a loaf of bread and an egg? (A17:15). Concomitative sense: xá-gaya y-asqə̀xwa |  ... kút-xa-w táxte dìye |  Sometimes we went up (onto the roof) ... everybody with his bed (B10:58). Before hal (until) expressing a range: kùllən, |  mən-yále zóre ʾu-hal-gòṛe |  All of us, from young children to old people (B16:4).

wădər.entry: wădər mən-bɛθa outside the house; dámxəx l-wằdər |  Let’s sleep outside (A12:11); ʾazítu palṭítu l-wằdər |  You should go outside (B1:13).

waduθa.entry: gắrəg mqàwlət |  ʾə̀lla |  kùllɛxu qaṭlənnɛ́xu. |  mə́re wadùθa. |  ‘But you have to promise, otherwise I shall kill all of you.’ He said ‘It is a promise’ (A12:14-15); waʿdùθa, |  kú-məndit bắyət ʾána ṱ-awðànnux |  I promise, I’ll do for you anything you want (A24:47); hát ʾóða wadúθa l-ʾiθàθux |  until she makes a promise in your presence (A12:29).

wajəbuθa.entry: ʾàxči |  šoqə̀tlən |  ʾàxni |  ṱ-ázəx ʾay-wajəbúθa mkamlə̀xla |  Just let us go to complete this task (A12:14).

wajju.entry: ʾáwwa dáwəq wàjju |  He will be useful (A29:18); ʾàti |  la-dóqət wájju mə̀nni |  You have no use for me (A30:14). Pl. personal effects | qímela múttəlla gu-ʾatnàbəl |  ʾu-wajjúwa díya kùlla |  They put her in a car, with all her effects (A21:5).

wala.entry: ʾəzzət wala wild goat, ibex (inhabiting mountains); táwrət wàla |  wild ox (A12:40).

walla.entry: le-šóqən lá xolamwàθa |  wálla ʾàti |  wálla yə̀mmi |  wálla ču-nàša |  I shall not let servants, you, mother or anybody (look after them) (A8:18).

warda.entry: warde žeri wild flowers of various colours, including red and green growing in fields; wardət dəbba large red flower

wardakka.entry: This appears in Barwar in the winter

waʿd.entry: waʿdə ʿărab (I give you an) Arab promise (A33:12)

wɛθa.entry: ʾéðət be-yálda ʾíle wɛ́θət Mšìxa |  The festival of Christmas is (in commemoration of) the birth of Christ (B6:12)

xa.entry: ʾíθwa xá-ʾotəx yan-trè |  There was one room or two (B5:199); ʾíθwa xa-nàša |  gu-ða-màθa |  There was once a man in a village (A48:1); máxa xa-mə́šxa gu-be-ʾéne dìye |  They put some oil on his forehead (B6:36); xa-xá-ga márət bɛ́θa mbašə́lwa ʾixála ʾímə-t hóya dànət ʾixála |  Sometimes the owner of the house would cook food when it was time for food (B6:16); xa-tré-yarxe xéne one or two months later (A1:16); šqílɛle xa-ʾárba xamšà béʾe |  He took four or five eggs (A23:6); bə́nyət-əlla ʾótəx tàma, |  qa-t mabə́sma kúd-yom xà |  You have built her a room there in order for her to entertain somebody everyday (A4:52); ʾə́θyɛle xàʾa |  A certain person came (A7:24); ʾánna xà-ṱ-ila |  These are one (= they are the same); ʾína qəm-xazə́nnəx ʾáti rába hawnànta, |  biš-mə́nni xa-tə̀rte |  I see that you are very clever, twice as much as me (A40:16); ʾən-háwe dàwa-ži |  ʾáxni t-yawə́xla xa-b-ṭḷàθa ʾə́lle díye |  Even if it is gold, we shall give him threefold (A7:10); kut-táwra mə́xyəlle xá gu-réše dìye |  He struck each ox a blow on its head (A30:23).

xabra.entry: ʾítli xákma xabráne ṱ-amrə̀nnəx |  I have a few words to say to you (A4:40); híwɛle xábra ta-wazíre dìye |  He gave word to his ministers (A4:9); xábra plìṭle |  Word went out (concerning the matter) (A4:21); šḗx hìwle xábre díye |  The sheikh has given his word (has promised) (A7:11); ṱ-amrə́nnux xa-xàbra |  I would like to tell you something (A18:7); wúð b-xàbri Do as I say (A8:43); wídla xàbra-xa |  They made an agreement (A12:37); ʾána hon-muθɛ́θa ʾáyya qùwwət láxxa |  b-xábra ta-dìyi |  I have brought this force here, which is at my command (A25:84).

xabuša.entry: xabušət ʾupra sweet potato; xabušət paθa cheek bone; xabúše kúlla msujlìley |  They registered all the apple trees (B1:18).

xabušta.entry: xabúšta ʾixàla |  apple tree bearing edible fruit (B5:104).

xačča.entry: xáčča tùna a little straw (B5:146), xáčča ṭína a little clay (B5:190); xáčča šarníye a few sweets (B5:40); xáčča mən-d-án-našət bɛ̀θa |  a few of the people of the house (B5:51). Used independently: ṭla-d-áy dráyɛla xàčča |  She serves a small amount for herself (A17:25). Modifier of an adjective: xáčča zàmət iyáwa |  It was a little difficult (B5:3), xáčča mə̀rya xónəx |  Your brother is rather ill (A32:27). Adverb: xáčča plìšela They fought a little (B5:163). xačča pyaša almost: xáčča pyáša plìšlun |  They almost fought (B1:17).

xaðuθa.entry: bréla ðá xadúθa gu-d-ò-ʾalma |  A (great) joy arose among the people (A4:56); hál ʾámra ṱ-óðəx xaðùθa |  Give us an order for us to celebrate (A14:46).

xāf.entry: lɛ-ʾáθya mtanòye, |  xā́f náše šmàʾəllɛni |  It cannot be told, lest people hear us (A35:11).

xakma.entry: xákma məndiyàne |  some things (B5:62); xákma šə́nne xène |  a few more years (B5:208); y-ápəxwale xámka yomàne |  We would bake for a few days (B10:91); báθər xákma dàna |  After a little time (B165). Used independently: xákma doqíwale xúwwa qaṭlìwale, |  xákma zădìwa |  Some took hold of the snake and killed it, some used to be afraid’ (B5:78).

xala.entry: xáli! Uncle! (vocative used to address men of an older generation irrespective of family relationship)

xălala.entry: ʾáwwa bɛ́θa xălàla-wewa |  This house was pure (A15:18).

xalqa.2.entry: xa xalqa mən-dăraje one step of a flight of steps.

xalta.entry: xalti! Aunt! (vocative used to address women of an older generation irrespective of family relationship)

xalwa.gloss: fatless curds of boiled yoghurt water (B6:43)

xaməštən.entry: ʾi-pɛ́ši qa-tré-yomaθa ṭḷá yomàθa |  hál mə́dre xáməštən ṱ-àsəq |  They wait for two or three days and then once again go up (to fetch loads) (B5:122).

xamoqa.gloss: dark in colour, blurred in colour

xamša.entry: ʾurzət xamša the fifth man; baxtət xamməš the fifth woman.

xamšaθn.entry: base for pronominal suffixes: xamšaθnən the five of us; xamšaθnɛxu the five of you; xamšaθnéy the five of them.

xamuṣa.entry: ʾan-ʾə́nwe xamùṣela |  the grapes are sour (A43:3).

xamθa.entry: ða-bráta rába xàmθa |  a very beautiful girl (A29:26); ʾíθwa xa-bàxta |  rába xàmθɛwawa |  There was a woman who was very beautiful (A8:21); ʾáy biš-xámθɛla m-kùlla |  She is more beautiful than them all (A25:26); baxtaθa xamaθa beautiful women.

xana.entry: réše díye múttəlle gu-xánət ða-bràta |  He had put his head in the lap of a girl (A29:26); yalúnka tíwɛle gu-xánət yə̀mme |  The little child is sitting on the lap of his mother.

xananta.gloss: female goat with a brown face

xanči.entry: ṣále xánči ʾúpra gu-réšət kʸàlo |  A little earth falls on the head of the bride (B8:34), xánči halúke ṱàrre |  a few unripe plums (B8:19); ʾən-wɛ́wa xànči |  If they were few ... (B10:6). Modifier of an adjective: ʾína bušála t-ʾoðə́xwala ṭlàlən, |  xánči miyànta |  But the stew, which we made for ourselves, was a little watery (B10:17). Adverb: šaxə́nwa xànči |  It heated up a little (B5:154), hal-qayə̀rwa xánči |  until it cooled a little (B5:164).

xanjər.entry: qəm-xarə́zla xánjər gu-kàse |  He stabbed the dagger into his stomach.

xanpa.entry: ʾu-Dùre |  píštɛla muqyàmta |  muxràwta |  šawwà gáye |  l-xànpe |  qaṭòle |  t-mušəlmàne |  Dure was evacuated and destroyed seven times by pagan murders of Muslims (B2:2).

xanum.entry: dax-xànum ʾay-tíwta gu-bɛ́θa |  Like a lady she sits at home (A37:3).

xapa.gloss: wooden peg used to connect the main body of a plough to the beam (mašana)

xapaya.entry: báxta xapɛ̀θa |  a woman is caring (A40:2)

xapro.gloss: small metal trowel for digging up vegetables

xăraba.entry: ʾu-máθa šwíqta xăràba-w |  and the village was left a ruin (B1:8).

xărama.entry: ʾáti xa-náša xăràmət |  You are a villainous person (A16:11)

xa-ramša.entry: mó ṱ-áxləx xa-ràmša? |  What shall we eat for dinner? (A2:2)

xaraya.entry: ʾáy wela-ʾá-bráta xarɛ́θət mṭúmra gu-Dùre |  That was the last girl to be buried in Dure (B1:12); ʾaw-tíwɛle xaràya |  He sat last (in the queue) (A17:31); máṭət ʾɛ-xarɛ́θət ʾòtəx |  You will reach the last room (A24:16); ʾánna šə́nne xaráye in recent years (B3:9); táwra zìlle |  b-xarɛ̀θa |  Finally the ox died (A22:6); ʾɛ-xarɛ́θət xarɛ̀θa |  in the end (A27:36).

xaraye.entry: bə́nta xaráye (A29:65), béna xaràye |  (B5:43) for the last time.

xarayuθa.entry: bas-tàma |  qə́ṣṣət dìyəx |  ʾu-t-xònəx |  pɛ́ša màṭya |  l-xarayúθa dìya |  There your story and that of your brother will (finally) reach its end (A8:88).

xarbuqta.gloss: knot (joining two pieces of rope); loop of a bird trap (nəšwa) made of horse hair; metal loop set to catch pigs by the legs

xarja.entry: maθyánət xárje-w bárjət boṭanàye |  the collector of taxes and the like of the people of Botan (A26:34)

xarnɛsa.entry: Wool is twisted around bottom and wool is pulled by connecting it to a spindle (kuša).

xarθa.entry: ʾɛ́-ga xárθa θéle xa-jăwāb qa-màlka |  Then, in the end, a report came to the king (A8:5); wéle spàra, |  xárθa xá-ga xéta xzèle |  ʾo-dìdwa |  plíṭle mən-d-ó bórət kèpe |  He waited and then he saw the fly come back out of the pile of stones (A11:5); yubqáθa b-áyya xàrθa |  Skirts (have been worn only) recently (B10:41).

xasla.gloss: cover put over mouth of small animals when they are weaned to prevent them from sucking

xāṣ.entry: y-áwe mtúrṣa xāṣ-d-ó-məndi |  It is made specially for that thing (B5:193)

xaṣa.entry: ʾu-yatə́xwa xāṣ-koðə́nta We would sit on the back of the mule (B5:138); xákma dwáqa xáṣe dìye |  ʾu-xákma darqúle dìye |  Some supported him and others were against him (A7:20); ʾíθwa b-xáṣi kamằra |  There was a belt around my waist (B10:37).

xašlana.gloss: crusher; a person using a grinding stone known as xašola

xašola.gloss: hand-held grinding stone for grinding rice or wheat

xašolta.gloss: grinding base with hole in centre in which xašola is turned

xašša.entry: bắyən lá-ʾaθi b-xàšša |  I do not want them to come in sadness (A4:33); ʾo-m-xášše mìtle |  He (almost) died of his grief (A32:12); rutət xašša Good Friday.

xaššana.entry: ṣléla xaššàne l-bɛ́θa |  They went down to their home sadly (A14:20)

xaṭər.entry: Only in idiomatic expressions: xaṭərux t-la twirali I who have not broken your respect (= have not disappointed you) (C2:13); xaṭə́rux lá torànna |  I shall not break your respect (= I’ll do what I can for you); bàs |  ʾɛ́ kawázət míya mattátla kəs-réša díya ʾu-bàs. |  mə́ra bábi hè |  dàx lítlux xáṭər. |  ‘Put out for her only that jar of water by her head and that’s all.’ She said ‘My dear, yes, I’ll do as you say (literally: how do you not have respect).’ (A21:10-11); mə̀re |  ʾána ʾədlɛ́le ʾárxa ṱ-áwən láxxa kə̀sləx. |  mə́ra málka dax-lítlux xàṭər |  He said ‘Tonight I shall be a guest in your home’. She said ‘Oh king, you are welcome.’ (A17:24); ṭlíbɛle xáṭər mə̀nna |  He took his leave from her (literally: He sought favour from her) (A25:66). Part. because; for the sake of.(1) because | ṭḷá-bnone xilìli, |  báxta xilàli, |  xáṭər ṱ-ínwa mk̭onə̀drəlla |  I have eaten the three children, I have eaten the wife, because I rolled her (down the hill) (A20:12).; (2) for the sake of | mút ṱ-óðən ʾàna, |  xáṭər ʾaláha? |  What can I do, for God’s sake? (A31:2); ʾámər xáṭər ʾalàha, |  ʾu-xáṭər mšìxa, |  bas-lá dáqrət bìyi |  For the sake of God and the Messiah, do not touch me (A15:21); xáṭər xaṭràna |  for the sake of respect (B5:10); bəd-xáṭər d-ó-xona zòra |  for the sake of that young brother (A12:22).

xatma.gloss: muzzle (preventing an animal from eating grain)

xaṭorta.entry: qaṭlíle b-xaṭoryàθa |  They kill him with washing-boards (B19:9); bəlbəlàwa |  kut-la-yàwa |  xaṭórta gàwa |  Bəlbəlawa, whoever does not give, (will have) a washing board (knocked) on him (said by children when going around the houses asking for gifts in the celebrations at the end of winter B7:8).

xaṭrana.entry: xaṭranət babux out of respect for your father; xáṭər xaṭràna |  for the sake of respect (for our family relationship) (B5:10).

xatta.gloss: line drawn on field by a plough
xatta.entry: ʾən-xátta pč̣ìlle, |  gnáyət táwra d-o-gòṛa |  If the line (drawn by the plough) is crooked, it is the fault of the big ox (D2:19).

xatun.entry: ṭḷá-mma xatáne b-xá xerìya. |  Three hundred ladies with one head cover (D1:9); síqla mə́ra ṭla-xàtun |  She (the servant girl) went up and told her mistress (A25:57).

xawxa.entry: Types of peach: xawxa koma black peach, xawxa č̣uwwa white smooth peach, xawxa serani white peach, xawxa məzzana hairy peach; ʾilanət xawxa peach tree.

xaya.gloss: alive. f. xɛθa in child birth
xaya.entry: baxta xɛθa woman who is giving birth or has recently given birth (forty or less days beforehand) (pl. baxtaθa xayaθa).

xaye.entry: b-xàyele |  He is alive; kúlla záwni b-xáye ṱ-àwyən |  all the time I am alive (A4:43); bróni mìθɛle. |  šwíqəlla xáye bìyəx. |  My son is dead. He has left his life (which remained to him) to you. (A4:42)

xayuθa.gloss: life; livelihood; living creature; vital feature
xayuθa.entry: rába xayúθa basìmtɛwa |  Life was very pleasant (B3:7); hal-hadíya xayuθèy |  l-xabùšela |  Until now people’s livelihood is made by apples (B5:75); ku-xayúθət ʾáwər gu-d-ay-wàdi |  ʾánna šəkwáne ṱ-axlìla |  every living creature that enters in this valley will be eaten by the ants (A14:55); ʾáwwa súla ʾíle xá xayúθət ʾaqàra kúlle Manure is a vital feature of the entire farm (B5:138).

xazada.entry: xazáda là-wele, |  mágla mgubèle |  He has not harvested anything, but he has chosen his scythe (D2:27), i.e. a bad workman blames his tools.

xăzina.entry: (1) treasure | xa-xəzzìnət dáwe |  a treasure of gold (A11:7); xu-lanwa-mírəllux maxzə́tli xăzìna |  I had not told you to show me a treasure (A14:23).; (2) storage vessel, tank | dwíqla xəzzíne məndiyáne mìya |  They kept the water in tanks and the like (A11:18).

xăzinta.entry: This consisted of a hole excavated from the ground covered with wood and earth. In general it was used to store nuts (such as baluṭe acorns) and root plants (such as šalgəmme turnips).

xelapa.gloss: willow tree, branch of a willow tree
xelapa.entry: ʾíθ xelápa ma-xelàpa. |  šangabì |  ṭúrxe díye ʾi-ṣáli l-ằra. |  xelápa drə̀stile. |  There are different types of willow. The weeping willow-its branches hang down to the ground. The (common) willow is straight.

xena.gloss: other, another; more; again; discourse particle.
xena.entry: (1) adj. other, another | mattúli xá-šəmma xèna |  Give me another name (A7:2); m-ya-góta xèta |  from the other side (A25:30); ʾu-mòdi-xenət xə́zya? |  What else have you seen? (A17:8). Additional: ða-kista-xéta max-d-áy yawə̀nnəx |  I shall give you another bag like that one (A4:16). Used independently: xa-xéna another one (A23:27); ða-xéta another one (A22:9); ʾo-xéna the other one (A4:45).; (2) more | tálga xèna |  more snow; xákma šə́nne xène |  a few more years (B5:208).; (3) adv. more, again | ʾána xéna šúla la-pàlxən |  I shall not work any more (A23:40); xéna ṛìšɛle. |  He woke up again (A14:95).; (4) mod. more | Modifier of a quantifer: šqílənwa xáčča xéna qàlya |  ta-ṱ-axlə́nne b-ʾùrxa |  I took a little more roasted meat to eat on the way (A23:10); zmúrrən xánči xèna |  Sing to us a little more (A35:8).; (5) discourse particle | expressing boundary and prominence: xéna políse mù ṱ-óði? |  Well, what should the police do? (A8:9); xéna ʾána qɛ́mən ʾázən ʾùmra |  Well, I shall go to church (A37:2); bàssa xéna |  Well that is enough (B15:35).

xēr.entry: xḕr-ila? |  How are things? (A22:16); ha-xḕr? |  Are you all right? (A27:22); ʾu-málla ṛìšɛle. |  mə́re ha-xḕr málla? |  The mullah woke up. He said ‘(Did you sleep) well, mullah?’ (A2:5); ʾən-šálla xḕr hawya-ʾúrxa |  God willing, the way will be good (A8:69); xēr-ʿala-xḕr Well done, good for you (A12:26); ʾáy ṛìšla |  qá-t ʾáwwa lɛ́le ʾə́θya b-xḕr |  She felt that he had not come with a good purpose.

xera.entry: də́ryɛle xéra b-gáne dìye He took courage (A8:57); xére zílle mṭušyàle gáne |  He quickly went and hid himself (A24:46); mtuxmə́nne ṱ-áwəð nxìlθa |  ṭla-madréla b-xerə̀tta |  He thought of doing a mischievous trick to make her throw it (the cheese) down in her excitement (A49:2).

xeriya.entry: Riddle: ṭlá-mma xatáne b-xá xerìya: |  harmònta |  Three hundred ladies with one veil: Pomegranate (D1:9)

xewa.gloss: hook used to adjust threads when weaving

xɛla.entry: xɛ́la díya mòdile |  t-mazvə̀rra? |  What is its power, which turns it? (B6:53); ʾə́θye xɛlăwáθət maymúne dart-yóma The forces (of the army of) the monkeys came the next day (A14:54); ʾáni b-xɛ́la bắyi mbarxíla ʾə̀lli |  They want to marry her to me by force (A7:18); b-xɛ̀la náše xazíle |  People scarcely see him; ʾu-b-xɛ́lət ʾalàha, |  har-Dúre lɛ̀-ʾaθya l-manšòye |  By the strength of God, Dure will never be forgotten (B2:7). draya xɛla to apply force, to struggle; to attempt: də́ryɛle xɛ̀la |  ta-t-šarə̀ṭla gáne |  He struggled to release himself (A26:81). ṣlăwaθət xɛle prayers for his strength, goriyət xɛle a sacrifice for his strength (blessings prefixed to names of saints): ṣlăwaθət xɛle Mar-Sawa the Blessed St. Sawa; Mar-Gwirgis goriyət xɛle the Blessed St. George.

xɛlana.entry: ʾína rába gabbàra |  xɛlàna-wewa |  But he was a very mighty warrior (A11:1); ṣríxɛle xa-qála ràba xɛlána |  He shouted a mighty shout (A11:3); xa-pláša ràba xɛlána-wewa |  It was a very fierce war (A11:16); məṭra xɛlanta heavy rain; talga xɛlana heavy snow; xa-xlùla |  ràba xɛlána |  a huge wedding (A12:23). Used adverbially: qəm-maxéla ʾáqla biš-xɛlàna |  He struck her leg harder (A33:12); ʾína ṣláya xɛlànɛle |  It (the river) is flowing down in spate (A14:58).

xɛpuθa.entry: ʾə́dyo xɛpùθɛla |  It is foggy today; qáyəm qèdamta |  ʾína xɛpùθa |  ryáma mən-ʾằra |  He got up in the morning and found that fog was rising from the ground (A25:43).

xəðya.entry: reši bēl xəðya l-xəðya My head is between one breast and another (C2:72)

xəðyuθa.entry: sab-ʾó-yoma xa-xəðyùθɛwa |  because that day was a joyful occasion (B5:62).

xəgga.gloss: dance performed with a line of people in a row with linked arms
xəgga.entry: xa-d-ánna dwíqɛwa réšət xə̀gga |  One of them was leading the head of the dance (B15:80). There are various types of this dance including: xəgga xḷiya (with bending of knees), xəgga belati (same as xəgga xḷiya), xəgga šexani, xəgga guršeni, xəgga šiša, xəgga yaqura.

xəlma.entry: ʾáwwa málka xzéle xa-xə̀lma |  This king had a dream (A1:2); ʾu-málka mšuréle zdàya xáčča |  ... xə́lme díye pàləṭ |  The king began to be rather afraid ... that his dream would come true (A8:6).

xəlya.entry: xóni ʾo-zóra l-xə̀lya wéwa |  My younger brother was on milk (B9:16)

xəlyana.entry: ʾítle ða-ʾə̀zza |  rába xəlyàntɛla |  He has a goat, which produces a lot of milk.

xəmma.entry: lɛ́le xə̀mma ʾəllɛ́xu? |  Are you not hot?; gu-bɛ́θa xə̀mma ʾiyéwa |  It was hot in the house (B5:204); tawə̀rwa xə́mma The heat would break (in the evening) (B5:160).

xəmmana.entry: xa-xamšušéba t-Támuz xəmmàna |  One Thursday in hot July (B1:15).

xəmmərta.entry: xəmmə́rθə šə̀nθa |  sleeping bead (magic bead used to induce sleep) (A19:3); xməryáθə tabzìye |  beads of rosaries (A25:34); xmərta goṛta large bead (at the end of a rosary)

xəppərta.entry: where white clay for the facing of houses is excavated

xərqa.entry: in neck cartilage: băláwala yabíšta xərqá xərqá gu-qðála díya mabyə̀nwa |  When she swallowed a raisin, it could be seen, ring by ring in her neck (A8:63); xərqət ʾilana growth-ring in tree; xərqət qana growth-ring in horn.

xərroza.gloss: string of dried fruit (e.g. figs, dates)

xərša.entry: wídla xə̀rša |  She did an act of magic; ʾítlən ða-ṱóṱo y-óða xə̀rše |  We have an old woman who does magic (A4:13).

xərṭa.entry: xərṭaṭət ʾiða lines of the hand

xərxəθ.entry: kúlla mnúle l-xə̀rxəθ |  They (the mules) are shoed back to front (with the shoes the wrong way round) (B4:13).

xərza.gloss: string (of beads, roe, spawn); amulet hung around neck in the form of a necklace to deter jinn
xərza.entry: xərzət xəmre sting of beads; xərzət kθɛθa string (of small unlaid eggs in stomach of a) chicken; oviduct of a chicken; xərzət pəqqa frog-spawn; tadpole; xərzət nune fish roe; young fish

xəšxəšone.entry: hóle wáða xəšxəšóne rəš-gðìla |  He is skating on the ice; hóle wáða xəšxəšóne gu-tàlga |  He is skiing in the snow.

xətna.gloss: bridegroom; son-in-law; father-in-law; husband of a relative (e.g. husband of paternal or maternal aunt, husband of a sister)

xəṭṭa.entry: ʾána ṱ-óðən xa-xə̀ṭṭa |  I shall make a plan (A12:35); mútte xə̀ṭṭa |  They laid a plan (B4:11).

xəṭṭe.entry: Four types of wheat: xwaraθa, huwedi, mərwəš and koča (without long hairs). xəṭṭət romaye, xəṭṭə romaye, xəṭ-romaye n.pl. maize | xa dəndəkθət xəṭṭə romaye a single maize seed. xəṭṭət šemaye n.pl. maize (= xəṭṭət romaye). Pl. xəṭṭane wheat plants | yárxət šáwwa tmànya, |  mšɛ́ri xzáda xəṭṭàne |  In July or August, they begin to harvest the wheat plants (B5:95).

xəyāl.entry: qṭíla xəyála dìya |  She has made up her mind (A8:49); xəyálɛxu mù-qṭila? |  What decision have you made? (B5:2); ʾu-gu-xəyála díya hóla màra |  She says to herself (A8:75); mŭčə́zəlla xəyàli |  He annoyed me (A17:7); la-bắyən măčəzə́nna xəyalɛ̀xu |  I don’t want to bore you; ʾítli xə̀yāl |  I have an idea (A21:36).

xəzmayuθa.entry: bắyəx ṱ-óðəx xəzmayúθa mənnɛ̀xu |  We want to make a family relationship with you (by marriage) (B5:4)

xəzwa.entry: xə́zwa škằra wéwa |  It was a clear vision (A2:6)

xiča.entry: wídle xóθe xíča b-qălàma |  He drew a line under it with a pen. Contrast xatta line drawn on the ground.

xlapa.gloss: in place of; for the sake of
xlapa.entry: ʾo dày |  ya-xlápax dày |  Oh mother, may I be your ransom, mother (A37:4); xlápa d-an-jundìye |  (May I be a ransom) for those soldiers (= Oh woe for the soldiers) (C3:1); xlàpux ya-ʾálaha |  (Let it be) for your sake (Let it be as you wish) (A9:4); xlápət ʾàlaha |  Thank God.

xloṣa.entry: šəbbaqa xloṣa a loose belt (anton. rpoxa loose).

xlula.entry: wídla xlùla |  They held a wedding (A4:56).

xmara.entry: xmarət dudiya curved wooden piece attached to the top of a cradle

xmira.entry: dɛrɛ́wa xmíra gáwa dìye, |  xămèwa |  They would put yeast in it (the dough) and it rose (B5:16).

xo.entry: Intensifying negation with remonstrating force: xo-la-mɛ́θən làxxa |  I shall not die here (A20:11); yába ʾan-ʾə́mma dàwe, |  xu-là mbaqrə̀təlli |  Well, do not ask me about those hundred gold coins (A14:65); xu-lanwa-mírəllux maxzə́tli xăzìna |  I had not told you to show me a treasure (A14:23). In negative questions, usually remonstrating: xo-lat-mírta xà-məndi? |  Did you not say something? (= surely you said something?) (A26:34); bábi tə́mməl ʾáyya mðíta xu-kùmta-wawa? |  Father, was this town not black yesterday? (= surely this town was black yesterday) (A4:35). In positive questions: gúrzə šə́rmux xo-ʾána ṱ-azə́nwa bìya? |  Would I be finished off by your stupid club (literally: the club of your behind)?! (A52:17). Introducing apodosis: ʾən-šắrəṭ díyi qəm-yăðə̀tla, |  xo-b-gawrànnux |  If you know (the answer to) my challenge, I shall indeed marry you’ (A25:62); ʾən-θèli |  xó bàxtiwət |  If I come back, then you are my wife (A25:66).

xoð.entry: xòðiwən |  I am alone (A22:32); pìšela |  har-ʾàni-tre l-xoðéy |  Only those two remained by themselves (A20:9); ʾáw xa-l-xóðe díye tămàha |  He is all alone there (A27:5).

xona.entry: xóna mənnɛ̀xule |  He is a brother to you (A25:22). Pl. xonăwaθa siblings | ʾu-ṭḷáθa xonăwàθi, |  ðá xáθa ʾu-tré xonăwáθa ʾìθwali |  My three siblings-I had a sister and two brothers (B9:1).

xonuθa.entry: pălə́xla kùlla |  b-ġðáðe b-xonùθa |  We shall share it among ourselves in fellowship (A14:18).

xoš.entry: xoš-ʾáwər ʾu-ʾáxəl ʾu-šáte gu-pərdɛ̀sa-w |  Let him enter and eat and drink in Paradise (A2:8); ʾu-bɛ́θux xoš-ʾàqəð |  and may your house burn down (A17:6); k̭áwa xoš-ṱ-awéwa pìša |  He should have remained alive (A7:20).

xošave.entry: the raisins, with their stems removed, are soaked in water until they become swollen

xošeba.entry: xošeba xaθa New Sunday (= the first Sunday after Easter) (B5:228); xošebət bnaθa Girls’ Sunday (Sunday before the beginning of the Lent fast, B7:1ff., B16:18ff.); xošébə bnàθa |  qə́ṭma b-quṣràθa |  On Girls’ Sunday there was (washing) ash in the cooking pots (i.e. the people fasted and washed their pots rather than using them for cooking) (B7:5).

xoθa.entry: with actions involving movement: ʾu-gríšle míya m-ṭùra |  muθéle xóθa-xoθət ʾùpra, |  muwə́rre gu-Dəmdə̀ma |  He drew water from the mountain, bringing it under the ground and directing it into Dəmdəma (A11:14).

xqira.entry: hátxa bába xqìrɛwət |  You are are a very respected father (A18:8).

xrawa.entry: y-áwəðwa xràwe gu-măḥálle |  He wrought havoc in his neighbourhood (A14:7); hot-wáða rába xràwe |  You are doing many wicked things (A25:81).

xtaya.entry: reša xtaya upside down; gallìyɛle, |  hátxa réša xtàyɛle |  It is a valley that slopes downwards (B19:3); ʾáθṛa t-xtàye |  the land of the dwellers in the lowlands (A37:5); kúlla ṣalɛ́wa gota-xtɛ̀θa |  They would all fall down (B5:43); díge-w kθàye |  ʾáp ʾan-zóre xtàye |  The cocks and the chickens, and also the small lowly creatues (should observe the fast) (B16:15). xtɛθa adv. below: ʾàni |  dɛrɛ́wa xtɛ̀θa |  They put these (the mats) below (i.e. on the ground) (B5:199).

xṭiθa.entry: xṭìθɛla! |  It is a sin! What a pity!; xṭiθèy-ila! |  What a pity for them! (A8:11); xṭiθɛ̀xula! |  What a pity for you (A8:26); xṭìθila |  What a pity for me (A11:11); xṭíθi b-qðalɛ̀xu |  bnóni qam-ʾɛ́ni là qaṭlítula |  I implore you (literally: my sin be on your neck), do not kill my children before my eyes (B9:13); mắdərre xṭíθi dìye |  Make him come back, I am feeling sorry for him (A24:53).

xubba.entry: npíltɛla b-xùbba |  She has fallen in love (A4:14).

xulaṣa.entry: xuláṣa ʾaláha mutə́pqəlle gu-d-a-mðíta ṱ-íla ʾɛ-bráta d-o-màlka |  In the end God made him come across the town where the daughter of that king was (A4:11).

xulqana.gloss: friend of the groom at a wedding
xulqana.entry: xulqane l-bɛθət babe The friends of the groom are at his father’s house (B8:23).

xumala.entry: lwíša júllət xumàla |  wearing festive clothes (A35:4); b-ʾaqla zargule ʾu-ʾəlla xumale On her legs are sheep-skin shoes, and on her (body) festive clothes (C6:2)

xumlana.entry: ʾap-ʾayyɛ́wa xa-xumlàna díyən |  This also was a form of merriment of ours (B5:33)

xumṣa.entry: xumṣət gupta sour remainder of cheese used for making new cheese; xumṣət masta sour remainder of yoghurt.

xumṣa.2.gloss: dish consisting of meat, rice and turnips

xura.entry: qíme tre-xùre. |  síqa š-xa-xùra. |  Two willow trees grew up. He climbed up one willow. (A18:26)

xurət.entry: ʾan-díyən wéla biš-xùrət |  Our (men) were stronger (B8:5).

xurma.entry: ʾilánət xùrme |  a date palm tree (A13:10).

xurta.entry: xúrta mgăríla kut-tre-šə̀nne |  They pollard the willow every two years.

xuwwe.entry: types of snake: xuwwe təðya, xuwwe koma, xuwwe balakšənka

xuya.entry: píšle xùya |  It became dark (A14:73); héš xúya xùyɛle |  It was still very dark (A30:36).

xwara.entry: xwarət beta the white of an egg

xwarθa.entry: (1) friend (f.).; (2) companion spirit | thought to bring about a hallucinatory fever: y-ámri ʾən-xáyər b-séra ràba, |  qapxále xwàrθe |  They say that if he looks at the moon a lot, his companion spirit will possess him. A metal object (e.g. a knife) is put under the pillow of a pregnant woman so that she is not afflicted by her companion spirit (qa-t-lá maxyála xwàrθa).; (3) placenta

xwiṣa.gloss: dish made from chopped flat bread (zeðaye) and butter (č̣ita)

xyapta.entry: xyaptət xətna the ceremony of the washing of the groom (before the wedding), accompanied by wedding songs (leliyane).

xzatta.entry: bar-sàməq, |  ṱ-ámrəx dā́n-t xzattɛla |  After it (the rice) becomes brown, we say that it is harvest time (B5:79).

ya.entry: ya-màlka |  O king (A25:13); yá-qazi ṱ-áwət basìma |  O judge, may you be healthy (A6:11).

ya.2.entry: yà-xăzina xzélux? |  What treasure have you found? (A14:13)

yaʾisa.gloss: husband of the sister of a wife

yaba.entry: šḗx yába hole-mšúdra bàrux |  The sheikh, take note, has sent for you (A7:8); yába ʾána ṱ-àθən |  Well, I’ll come (A7:9).

yăk̭ana.entry: ʾaw-málka ʾíθwale xa-bròna, |  yăk̭àna |  That king had an only son (A4:1).

yaləxta.entry: This is waved around in a xəgga dance. It is usually decorated with tassels.

yalla.entry: de-yàlla! |  Let’s go ahead (with the plan) (A44:3). Sometimes combined with də- (particle of immediacy §15.1.5.2., §15.7.): də-yàlla! |  Let’s go! (A8:82).

yamiṣa.entry: It grows in cool places in high mountains.

yan.entry: ʾáwwa nablə́xle kəs-d-ày |  yan-ʾáy nablə́xla kəs-d-àwwa? |  Should we take him to her or take her to him? (A4:3); mjárbu mɛ́θu náše duxtùre-u |  yan-náše spáy t-yắði bud-màrra |  Try to bring doctors, or fine people who know about the illness (A8:32).

yaqura.entry: sə́twa y-awéwa yaqùra |  Winter was hard (B5:155); báxta hóla yaqúrta bud-yàla |  The woman is with child; baxtáθa tə̀rwəθna hóla yaqùre |  Both women were pregnant (A25:2).

yarqa.entry: ṱ-oðánna yàrqa-lley |  I shall make it into a vegetable stew for them (A34:18).

yarxa.entry: təltàssər b-yɛ́rxa |  the thirteenth of the month (B16:22); yarxət tre February; yarxət ʾəč̣č̣a September; rešət yarxa the beginning of the month; ʾítla réšət yàrxa |  She has a menstrual period.

yaṣila.gloss: outer edge (of wall, window); outer corner (of building); side (of door)
yaṣila.entry: kút yaṣílət qàṣra |  ʾíθ ða-yàwna gáwe díye |  On every corner of the palace there is a dove (A12:24); rúše díye qíθɛle b-yaṣílət tằra |  His shoulder hit the side of the door (A29:10). Cf. zawiθa inner corner

yasoṛa.entry: yasóṛe y-asṛíwale b-púmmət tàwra |  Tethers tied it (the cross beam) to the mouth of the bull (B5:83).

yəmma.entry: yə́mmət marɛ̀θa |  original leaven (cheese, yoghurt used as a starter to produce more) (B16:25)

yoma.entry: (1) day | xa-yóma síqe-wawa l-ṣɛ̀da |  One day they had gone up (the mountains) out hunting (A25:2); yóma qamàya on the first day (A25:14); hàr ʾo-yóma on the same day (A25:4); yómət xyáptət xə̀tna |  on the day of the washing of the groom (B15:74); pálgət yòma |  at midday (B5:62); zílla b-yomàθa |  They travelled for days (A29:37). In absolute state: kút-yum ðà-brata gawə́rwa |  Every day he would marry a girl (A14:1).; (2) sun | yóma xrùle |  the sun was eclipsed; ʾɛ́-gət zarə́qwa yòma, |  palṭə́xwa xorăwáθa kúlla m-ġðàðe |  When the sun rose, we friends would all go out together (B15:5); zraqət yoma East: y-azíwa l-zràqət yóma |  They would go towards the East (A8:22); yóma, yóma mgáli pàθux, |  šáxni bnónux ʾu-bnàθux, |  ʾu-ʾap-kalàθux |  Sun, sun reveal your face, so that your sons, your daughters and your daughters-in-law may be warm (said when a cloud goes over the sun); hádəx-ila šṭrànta |  max-d-àwwa yóma |  She is as beautiful as this sun (A7:17).

yunja.entry: green in colour, fed to animals

zăbun.entry: báxta xáčča zàbbun-ila |  a woman is rather weak (A10:12).

zaga.entry: ʾána maxə́nne zágət ʾùmra |  I shall ring the church bell; qále díye ṣə́pya ʾax-zàga |  His voice is clear as a bell.

zakkan.entry: guði daryən gu-ʾiθaθi zakke zakkan l-ʾiθaθi I put my churn in my hands, splash, splash on my hands (C5:8).

zakke.entry: guði măyanne b-zakke I shall churn my churn with the sound of splashing (referring to the yoghurt splashing in the churn) (C5:2).

zalala.entry: míya y-áwɛ zalàle |  The water is clear (B10:9); čay zalalta weak tea.

zamara.entry: rába zamàra-wewa |  He was a fine singer (A25:43).

zamət.entry: zámətila wàðəlle |  It is difficult to do it; ʾə́n zámət lá-hawya ʾə̀llux |  hálli kθàwa |  If it is not difficult for you, give me the book (= Please give me the book).

žare.entry: žáre ʾə̀lle |  It is a pity for him.

žare.2.entry: ʾo-yála zóra žàre |  The young boy, poor thing (A14:12); žɛ́re Fàrxo |  ṱ-íwən ʾána b-hìwi díya |  Poor (me), Farxo, who am waiting in hope for her (A25:18).

zarpəkka.gloss: red spot on skin, mosquito bite
zarpəkka.entry: plíṭla zarpə́kke gu-ʾíðe dìye |  His hand came out in spots.

zarrəkθa.entry: It was produced by boiling oakwood ash in water and used for washing clothes and washing grapes.

zawdana.entry: bas-ʾána zodànta-llɛxu |  quṣárta mə́nni t-muθéli llɛ̀xu |  But the cooking pot that I have brought you is an extra one for you (A5:6).

zawərta.gloss: earthenware container for water for cooking in house or carrying on a journey
zawərta.entry: zawə́rtət kʸàlo |  the bride’s pot, which was filled with sweets and fruit and broken by the bride before entering the groom’s house (B8:33).

zawga.entry: (1) pair | dɛríwa xa-záwgə tòpe |  They used to fire a couple of shots; qyàmela |  xá-zawgət xoriyàθa |  A pair of willow trees sprang up (A26:90).; (2) even number | zawge ʾu-pare even and odd numbers; zawge ʾu-k̭atte even and odd numbers.

zawna.entry: záwna lebàna-wewa |  The time was tricky (A1:22); b-awwa zawna at this time; ʾày |  hălikòptər y-áwa, |  ṭla-d-áw zàwna |  It was a helicopter of that time (A27:20).

zawnaya.entry: ʾaxni naše zawnaye We are ancient people (C1:16); ṣadra darga t-zawnaye Her breast is a door of the ancients (C2:47).

zaxma.entry: xá gáwṛa xɛlána-w zàxma wéwa |  He was a powerful, tough man (A27:1).

zaya.entry: zayət qaṭu kittens; zayət ʾaqubra young mice; zayət ʾarya lion cubs

zduθa.entry: síqela rəš-d-ay-ʾilána m-zdùθa |  They climbed the tree out of fear (A13:11).

zeðaya.gloss: round thick flat bread made from wheat cooked on the sides of an oven

zeriya.entry: qumta xlita zeriye her sweet golden stature (C6:7)

zɛθa.gloss: olive (tree); olive oil. ʾilanət zɛθa olive tree; məšxət zɛθa olive oil

zəbbara.entry: Such groups consisted of men from the village who volunteered their labour to help a member of the village undertake various types of task, such as gathering leaves (ṭarpa), harvesting wheat (xzada xəṭṭe), harvesting rice (xzada rəzza) and building a house (bnaya bɛθa); yomət zəbbara a day in which work was done by such a volunteer group.

zəbla.entry: zə́blət haywàne |  the manure of animals (B5:134)

zədya.entry: mà-lux zə́dya? |  Why are you afraid? (A11:6)

zəmra.entry: šmili xa qalət zəmra I heard the sound of song (C2:6).

zēn.entry: mṭéle gu-d-ày-maθa |  ham-zḕn |  He was lucky to arrive in that village (A37:14).

zənja.entry: made of woven sticks, covered at the top by leaves (ṭarpa) and hay (puwuš).

zənjir.entry: síṛɛwa zənjíre b-rušàne |  He had been tethered with chains on his shoulders (A26:81)

zəqqora.entry: zəqqora bəd-ʾìða a fabric woven/knitted by hand

zəqta.gloss: point at the end of an animal goad (massa)
zəqta.entry: zə́qta mxéle l-tàwra |  He stuck the point of the goad into the ox.

zərana.entry: qəm-maxənne xa zərana I slapped him

zərmaziya.gloss: small spiky type of oak gall (mɛša, paṛma)

ziqa.entry: truq ziqux! Wrap up well (literally: Button up the neck of your shirt); xóne b-zìqa |  his brother (who was as close to him as) the neck of his shirt (A32:26).

zirək.entry: xákma doqíwale xúwwa qaṭlìwale. |  rába zirə̀k-wɛwa. |  Some grasped the snake and killed it. They were very courageous (B5:78).

zōj.entry: bắye ṱ-awə́dlən zṓj He wants to trick us (A14:13)

zolala.gloss: tendril of a plant; vein within a leaf
zolala.entry: some plants have tendrils (zolale) that extend along the ground, e.g. paṭiroke

zor.entry: b-kúlla yóma zór maṣìwa |  xàzdi |  xá-mdi rába baṣòra |  In a whole day they can barely manage to harvest a very small amount (B5:144); b-zòr-ṃaḷe |  ṭla-mapláxtət bɛ̀θa |  There was scarcely enough for household use (B5:215).

zreta.entry: zrétət rə̀zza |  the cultivation of rice (B5:76)

zroqa.entry: rare equivalent of milana: šəṭrantux ʾɛna zroqe Your sweetheart-her eyes are blue (C2:33).

zruta.entry: ; yála θéle mən-zrùta |  The young man came back from working in the fields (A21:8).

zuryat.entry: ʾína ʾaláha yíwle zúryat gawèy |  But God granted progeny among them (B2:10).

zuze.entry: ṱ-óðəx zùze |  We shall make money (A14:14); ʾána zúza lìtli |  I have not got a penny (A22:19).

zvərta.entry: mə́xyəlle ʾáqle l-dudíyət Qaṭìna, |  šawwí-zəvre zvìrtəlla |  He kicked the cradle of Qaṭina and span it round seventy times (A52:2).

zwaða.entry: ʾu-čánte díye dwíqla zwàðe |  She packed his bag with provisions (A21:22); ma-yəmmi pɛli zwaðe Mother, bake for me provisions (for my journey) (A50:9).

zyatta.entry: zyáttət mìya |  increase in water, flood (B6:19)
